1.content:
James slowly moved down the hall, his CAR15 at the ready. He was one the third sub-level of this the cult compound, He remembered from the SAT images that there was at least 2 more sub-levels bellow him. The hall was dark, there had been some sort of surge early that had blown most of the lights and the ones that still worked were either dim or flashing. The emergency lights didn't help, just bathed everything in a red glow. James saw that up ahead the hall turned to the left. He approached it, hugging the wall and peeked around the corner with just his eyes so no one would see him easily. There was no one. It had been a while since he heard anything, either and echo or from the radio. every time he turned of the radio all he got was static so he had it off so as not to give away his position. He ready himself and slowly stepped around the corner making a sweep to double check that is was clear. He saw a door a few meters down the hall and that the hall continued on for a few more meters after that to a junction.
He decided he would.....
1.title: Alone....

11.content:
James decided to continue down the hall, his CAR 15 raised and sweeping: the steady thump of his boot heels his only companion, the dripping of water from a leaky pipe his only annoyance . As he drew level with the door he nudged it with the barrel of his CAR but to no avail, the door was locked and it wasn't budging any time soon.

"No matter" James spoke taking comfort in the sound of his own voice "I wasn't planning on going that way anyway"

As he resumed his cautious pace down the hall he turned on his radio again only to be met with the screech of static. James winced as he shut the radio off only to realize that the hall had gone completely silent, just as he stood there gripped by a growing sense of icy dread a bloodcurdling scream shattered the silence. James glanced down at his radio half expecting it to be the cause of the disturbance , however the switch was still in the off position.

As James raised his CAR and started to scan the area he began to hear the thud of foot steps

Thud, thud, thud. Jame's mind began to race looking for possibilities

Thud, thud, thud. To his right he saw an alcove that he could hide in, while at the same time his mind registered that he could probably take whoever it was with his CAR 15.

The scream was closer this time, a booming inhuman howl that made James want to jump out of his skin. As James looked closer at the T intersection he noticed that the lights on the left hand side began to flicker.
11.title: Continue down the hall

choices: Jumped out of the alcove with his CAR 15 at the ready
peeked around the corner of the alcove once more
111.content:
Jame's slid into the alcove, sliding down the wall into a crouching position. He knew that the CAR would cut through anything that he encountered, but his orders came back to him, echoing in his mind. Minimum casualties if possible.

Thud thud thud, the booming footsteps were growing louder now and the emergency lights in his corridor were beggining to grow dimmer.

Thud thUD THUD! Suddenly the footsteps stopped and he could hear a deep rhaspy breathing coming from the direction of the intersection. He readied the CAR in front of him and stole a glance around the corner of the alcove, what he saw made his breath leave him in a sudden whoosh.

Standing at the end of the hall was a creature, no a beast. It was maybe seven feet tall, and under the dim glow of the red lights he could see that it had its head raised to the ceiling, and it was sniffing. The beast had a human form, but seemed to be grotesquely disfigured. Its entire body was coated with some kind of ooze, and under the red light Jame's couldn't tell what color that ooze was, in his heart though he knew it was red. Blood, the beast was covered in blood and from the bits of flesh hanging from the creature's teeth he doubted that the blood was its own.

The left hand of the beast dangled at its side, and Jame's could see that halfway up the forearm of the thing that the flesh there had been ripped all the way through, and that the bone had been shattered leaving it to hang by a small scrap of flesh. As if the beast could hear his thoughts it reached down and grabbed its own wrist with its right hand and pulled it slowly away. James could hear the flesh ripping, and choked back the urge to vomit as it fell away with a wet smacking sound.

The beast dropped its head and looked in Jame's direction and for the second time he fought back that vomiting urge, the creature had no eyes, just two empty black sockets. It let out a guttaral growl in Jame's direction and chunked the hand down the corridor towards him, it hit the floor beside the little alcove with a sloppy smack and Jame's watched as the fingers writhed against the ground, seeming to reach for him.

Jame's closed his eyes and slid back up the wall, he still had confidence in the CAR but it was lessened now. He took three deep breaths and then he...
111.title: Dive into the Alcove

choices: Go to the left (Follow the beast)
Go to the Right (Avoid the beast)
1111.content:
“Screw it; this is a no BS situation” James thought “whatever the fuck that thing was it just strengthens my determination to move NOW!”
James took a few deep breaths counted to three and swung around the corner CAR at the ready, only to find an empty hall way with a blood trail going back down the left side of the T.
“Where the fuck did it go!” James’s mind blathered “How could something so big vanish without a goddamn sound, especially since it shook the frigging ground as it approached!”
“Which way should I go” James mused “on the one hand I don’t want to follow that thing back to where there could be more of its kind, but on the other hand I don’t want that kind of enemy on my six”
1111.title: Jumped out of the alcove with his CAR 15 at the...

choices: proceeded down the stairs toward the sound
slowly backed his way up the steps toward the door
11111.content:
"Fuck it" Jame's said out loud.

He looked down at the curled fingers of the hand that was laying on the ground, and for the first time he realized that they were claws ending in sharp points of bone. He bent down and poked it with the barrel of the CAR, and the fingers immediantely curled into a fist, tightening its grip with so much force that the points of the fingers began to disappear slowly into the flesh of its palm. He kicked it hard back down the corridor that he had just came from, enjoying the sickening thud as it struck the wall.

"What the fuck is going on here?" Jame's thought.

He reached down and clicked his radio on, cursing loudly as the static screech rang out through the hall. He thumbed it off angrily, and raised his CAR in the direction of the intersection. He thought about flicking on the flashlight attachment on the end of the CAR, but then dismissed the idea. The only thing that he had going for him was surprise now, and running through the corridors with a bright white light wasn't going to do him any good.

Jame's pressed himself against the wall and side stepped his way to the end of the corridor, he peered around the edge of the wall in the direction that the beast had disappeared and saw that the bloody trail disappeared around another sharp turn about fifty yards down the corridor. Another thing that he noticed was that there were four finger grooves dug into the wall on the right hand side of the wall.

"Jesus fuckin christ" he muttered.

He jumped the trail of blood and pressed himself against the wall with the grooves in it and made his way slowly down to the turn. He readied the CAR and jumped out into the open, letting out the long breath that he had been holding. Empty. At the end of the hall was an elevator shaft, the doors were buckled in and he could see that the shaft was empty. An electrical cable hung in the empty shaft, throwing sparks every few seconds as it struck the door. On the left was another door, or what was left of a door. The medal had been shredded and it hung by one hing at an awful crooked angle, the room beyond was as black as midnight. Jame's slowly made his way down to the room and with expert fingers he reached up and clicked on the flashlight and then swung it into the room sweeping back and forth in fast strokes. Empty.

He looked across from the room and in another little alcove he saw the empty rectangle were a door used to be, and beyond that he could see stairs leading down into darkness. The blood trail led this way.

"No other choice bro" he said to himself.

He crossed the space to the small door and swept his flashlight across the stairs and over the rail to the flights below, the blood trail ended on the second flight down leading through another door. Jame's braced himself and slowly made his way down the steps, carefully avoiding the blood. When he made it to the landing between floors below him, Jame's froze. He could hear a wet smacking sound, like a boot falling in wet mud followed by a sickening dragging sound. The sounds were coming from below him, something was coming up the steps, no dragging itself up the steps. Jame's covered the end of his flashlight with his hand and then...
11111.title: Go to the left (Follow the beast)

choices: James knows that there is not anything he can do.
111112.content:
James quickly but quietly retreated back up the steps until he was back in the hall with the elevator the like mercury over velvet he crept back behind the next wall and prayed to god that whatever was making the god awful noise would just go down the elevator.

As he settled himself into a comfortable position and quieted down he could hear the creature’s foot steps

"Splat, SPlat, SPLAT"

The creature stopped no more then ten meters from James's current position and James began to hear a sickening gargling noise that sounded like a cross between someone hacking up flem, and gargling mouthwash at the same time. James desperate to see what it was quickly took off his wrist watch and gingerly eased it out into the corridor enough so he could see the reflection but close enough that the creature couldn't see his reflection.

What James saw terrified him, the creature was: seven feet tall, it had the appearance of a three week old corpse that someone had dug up, had some sort of tentacles going down the left side of its body including its leg which was the cause of the splat sound, also it had a human body in it's tentacles, or at least what was a human body at one point as now it had tentacles going into and out of every orifice in its body and looked partially absorbed into the creature and the body's intestines were hanging out of its lower end as it's legs were ripped off, hence the dragging sound.

As James continued to stare at the grisly monstrosity reflected back at him it all of a sudden bent over and began to wretch out green slime. As James looked closer he realized that he could see human organs in the slime.

“Wait, human organs but where would it get them from?” James mused, then it hit him "That thing must be sucking them out of the body on its side!"

James fought back a shudder of revulsion and the urge to throw up at the same time. As he continued to watch he noticed the AC units in the section begin to start up and after a few minutes he began to smell the stench but that wasn't the worst part. The AC must have trigger a tactile response as the human body began to twitch and a few seconds it began to scream, or at least try to as a big fat tentacle was blocking it's mouth.
111112.title: slowly backed his way up the steps toward the door

1111121.content:
James clicked the safety off of the CAR, trying to be as quiet and stealthy as possible. He could still hear the god awful thing wretching, and something grew inside of him, past the disgust and the horror that old familiar feeling slowly began to seep back into his veins. Rage. Rage was his friend, and rage is what he needed most right now.

James clicked the flashlight on and swung out into the hall, at the last second he froze, the body that was inside this hideous monster was Louis. He and Louis had grown up together and it had been his idea to join ATHER, he hadn't seen Louis since they had gotten split up.

"Jesus no" James moaned as he began to drop the CAR.

The creature turned to James and it's gut began to pull in and out as it prepared to spit more of that fucking slime. He met Louis's eyes, and knew that his friend was to far gone.

"I'm sorry Lou" James said quietly as he raised the CAR back to his eye.

James fired the CAR, enjoying the eruption of noise in the small corridor as round after round pumped into the stomach of the creature. Chunks of blood and gore began to splatter against the wall behind the thing and James closed his eyes until the clip ran out. As the smoke began to clear James heard an awful sloppy thud, and the flashlight fell on the creature. James had cut it in two. With horror James began to back away, the fucking thing was still alive, but now both pieces were sliding towards him across the floor.

James took another step back and slipped in the blood trail that the other creature had left, he hit the ground with a thud, the thing was almost on him. He jumped to his feet but now he was blocked, the wall behind and the creature in front. James spotted a CO2 fire extingusher hanging on the wall next to him....
1111121.title: James tries to help

11111212.content:
James took the fire extinguisher off the wall and threw it towards the slithering mass on the floor in front of him He then whipped out his 45 having lost his CAR 15 in the fall and fired a bullet into the withering maw of tentacles that had swallowed the extinguisher.

The result was nothing short of amazing as the CO2 rapidly enveloped the tentacles, as more of the CO2 shrouded them they began to expand and contort. James having already pieced together what was going to happen quickly scooped up his CAR and booked it around the nearest corner. Just in time for as soon as he slammed his back up agents the corner every tentacle exploded simultaneously showering green gore up and down the hallway.

James peeked around the corner to observe his handiwork; all he saw was a steaming puddle of paste. James began to laugh as he came down from the adrenaline high of combat, after his laughing fit was over James once again shouldered his CAR and moved out down the hall.

As he rounded the next corner his radio suddenly burped static then resolved into a voice that James knew too well

"This is PFC Felicha Mennen broadcasting on all frequencies calling any ATHER personnel"

James quickly plucked his radio off his belt and brought it up to his mouth

"This is Sergeant James Anderson ATHER team ECHO commanding"
11111212.title: Use the fire extingusher

111112121.content:
"Oh thank fucking christ" Felicha bellowed through the static of the radio.

"Where are you soldier?" James asked her patiently.

"I..I..I don't know" she said, her voice becoming a little shaky.
"We were in the third sublevel when something....something unhuman drove us back. We retreated as far back as we could and then fled to the drainage tunnels. That...thing...it fucking ate Johnson! Fucking ate him, no fucking absorbed him!" she screamed into the radio.

"Calm down Felicha, get ahold of yourself" James said calmly.

"Sorry sir, Johnson was my friend" she said quietly.

James dropped the radio a bit and shut his eyes tight, he remebered Lou's eyes when they had met his. The pain in those eyes, the horror. He pushed the memory away.

"Who is with you?" He asked as he brought the radio back up.

"Ummm, Me and Benson and Franklin. We got seperated though, I am all alone down here Sarge." she said shakily.

"Stay put girl, I am coming to you" James said as he turned back into the corridor and headed for the stairs.

"Ok...wait, I hear someone" she said excitedly.
"Benson! Franklin!" she cried into the radio"

There was a long pause then and James froze.

"Felicha..." he said into the radio.

Suddenly there was a piercing scream coming through the radio and James had to turn the volume knob down a bit. The scream trailed off and suddenly gunfire erupted through the radios screaching speaker, and then the radio went to straight static again.

James sat there for a moment and wondered what he should do...
111112121.title: Felicha hears him

1111121211.content:
"Hang on Felicha I'm on my way!" James yelled into his radio as he began to run to where one of the entrances to the drain system was remembering from a schematic he remembered seeing on sub level one.

As James ran boots pounded on concrete just as they had the day they first met.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ---------------------------------------------

James's boots echoed hollowly down the hall as he strode down the empty barracks block of the ATHER complex towards the exit. All of the soldiers had retired home for the long weekend as James was doing now. His wife was away on a one year long sabbatical from her job as a biology teacher at the local high school so he once again had the whole house to himself.

As James got into the driver’s seat of the car he sat in a slight defocus as he struggled to contain his mounting aloneness and despair, his wife having been gone for the better part of five months and there being no one else at the house that he could talk to. James started up the car and began to drive home his only plans being a bottle of beer and a lonely night of watching old reruns on TV.

Once James got in the house having just parked the car in the garage and checked his empty answering machine he took off his shoes and wandered into the kitchen. As he rummaged around in the fridge he recalled how happy he had been when he and Helen had gotten married, and how he had been even happier when they spent three magical weeks in Italy together as their honeymoon.

James sighed as he stood up beer in hand and moved to his lay-Z-boy recliner and twisted the cap off, remembering all of the fights soon after the wedding: bills, payments, friends, but most of all children Helen would never stop about having children. Eventually it got to the point where he and Helen couldn’t even share a bed together and he was out on the couch, as the tension mounted James turned to drinking to help and soon she was on his back about that as well.

When the sabbatical came up Helen had jumped at the chance to get out of the house and away from him, her last words to him were at the airport when she turned to him at the gate and said

"Pick me up here in a year" and with that had turned and boarded the plane.

At first James had loved it: no more fights, no more arguing, no more children, no more shit! But soon the magic began to disappear as James realised that all he wanted to do was make up with Helen and have her back with him.

James caught up in the memories didn't realize that he had finished his beer, as he went to get another one from the fridge he realized that it was raining quite heavily out. When James sat back in his recliner again he just stared out the window watching the raindrops patter against the window.

James was mesmerized by the show of water for some time until he saw a pair of car headlights stop in front of his house and he began to hear the crunch of footsteps. As he turned towards his door the doorbell rang and he rushed to get it tripping over his shoes in his haste. By the time he untangled himself from his shoes and got to the door the person had begun pounding on the door.

"Just a second" James croaked as he staggered to the door and opened it.

Standing outside soaking wet was a young woman in her mid twenties and there was something familiar about her.

"Oh Lieutenant Anderson I didn't realize that this was your house" the woman sputtered. "I just came here because my car broke down and my phone fell in a puddle while I was trying to fix it"

"Would you like to come in" James questioned as he leaned against the door jamb looking up at the pouring rain.

"Yes sir, thank you sir" the woman replied as she stumbled in to the house

"You seem to have me at a disadvantage ma'am" James replied in response to her 'sir'

"Oh sorry sir" the woman replied looking slightly embarrassed “I'm PFC Mennen”

"Wait" James replied "Felicha right?"

"That’s right sir" Felicha grinned "the FNG of ECHO team"

James snorted with amusement FNG meant fucking new guy of in Felicha's case it meant fucking new girl.

"Mennen we are off duty drop the Sir" James commanded as they walked up the stairs into the kitchen.

"Yes...James" Felicha replied as she looked around the kitchen "Uhh.. Where is your phone?"

"Huh?" James grunted

"To call the tow truck" Felicha answered

"Oh" James replied "It's hanging up on the other side of the wall"

"Thank you" Felicha expressed as she made her way around the wall.

James began to rummage around in the fridge as Felicha made her call. James grabbed what he was looking for, shut the door, and turned around

"Felicha" he called

"Hmmm" she grunted as she leaned around the wall covering the receiver with one hand, James held the beer up. She mouthed yes as she leaned back around the corner and finished the call.

As James sat back down in his recliner and began to drink his beer, Felicha passed his chair holding her hand out for the promised beer. Smiling he dropped the beer into her hand as she took up the couch opposite him and twisted her beer cap off as well taking a long drink.

"Thank you" Felicha replied holding up her beer

"No problem" James replied looking up at the rain pattering on the windows

"The towing company says they'll send up a rig first thing tomorrow, something about the roads being too muddy tonight" Felicha said nervously "So can I stay at your place tonight?"

"Sure" James replied "You can use the guest bedroom"

"Ok thanks" Felicha responded with a smile, James just stared off into space.

For the next twenty minutes James and Felicha talked on and off about a multitude of topics all related to ATHER. Finally James looked at the clock and saw that it was getting late, as he stood up to leave Felicha got up as well and walked up to him and kissed him square on the lips, James in sock for a moment just stared impassively at Felicha.

Felicha began to stammer an apology but before she could say anything James kissed her back passionately. After that all James could remember was staggering towards the bedroom, laying in the bed that he hadn't lain in for so long and the patter of rain drops on the window as the night turned to day.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ----------------------------------

James shook off the memory with a visible effort and began to descend the ladder that he knew would take him down to the drains, and Felicha.
1111121211.title: Head to the drains

11111212111.content:
As he reached the bottom of the ladder he noted that there was a large smear of blood along the far wall. When his boots touched bottom he spun away from the ladder and brought his CAR up sweeping both to the left and right of him.

James was about to try the radio again when a piercing scream cut through the darkness to his left

"Felicha!" James roared in the direction of the scream "Felicha!"

James took off sprinting in the direction of the scream although now that he thought about it something seemed off about the scream, it sounded just like the one on the radio. James continued to sprint down the drain his mind running even faster through all of the possible horrors that could await him at his destination.

The scream sounded again just like the first two, that sealed it for James now he knew something was not quite right. As James rounded the final corner he was shocked and disturbed to find...
11111212111.title: Continue

111112121111.content:
James could not quite believe what he was seeing: it looked like a giant blob, was midnight black, and was screaming at a round metal hatch. Wait it wasn't quite blob like, James did notice something on its sides, after close inspection he realized with a shock that they were human faces.

James backed behind the wall and pondered what to do, the only advantage he had was surprise as the creature had not heard his yells due to the fact that its screams were louder than his. However it was only a matter of time before the creature spotted him and ruined his element of surprise, as he turned back to look at the creature it screamed one of its powerful screams and James saw all of the human faces contort in agony. James wondered why the faces didn't scream but then it hit him, the creature used its victims vocal chords to mimic anyone's scream.

As the creature screamed again James saw the metal hatch begin to buckle, James's mind raced

"That things screams are powerful enough to buckle metal"

This told James two things: one that he had to be careful in dealing with this thing, and two that he had to get the thing away from the hatch where he was sure Felicha was hiding. But first he should warn Felicha about what was happening.

"Felicha come in" James whispered. As soon as he finished a scream came over the radio, the scream was so intense and so painful that James fell to the ground clutching his ears in agony and rolling around like a dog.

James could hear the beast coming up on him and he knew he had to move, so as painful as it was he removed his hands from his ears and feebly reached into one of his vest pockets for the set of heavy duty earplugs he carried and shoved them in his ears. The feeling of relief was immediate as was the ability to think clearly, James immediately scrambled to his feet picked up his radio by this time the beast was nearly upon him.
111112121111.title: A terrifying Demon

1111121211112.content:
James was not fleeing in the traditional sense of running away he was leading the creature away from the hatch to somewhere where he could either slip away from it or kill it. As James ran down the drains the thing hot on his tail he was glad that he had put in his earplugs as the thing kept screaming away and even with the earplugs it hurt but at least it no longer paralyzed him.

James turned a corner not even sure of where he was going until he saw a small circle of light off in the distance and knew that the pipe lead to the outside world. James almost slipped while he was running due to the fact that there was actually a current leading out to the opening, James grinned as he realized that he could use this to his advantage.

As he ran James searched desperately along the walls for the one thing that he needed to make this plan work and at the last second found it, a metal grab bar right at the lip of the tunnel. James ran for the bar at full tilt as the monster followed him, then at the last second James grabbed the bar and swung out onto a lip of concrete no bigger than his foot. As he looked down he discovered that he was at least a hundred feet off the water of the local lake that all of the cult's drain water flowed into. James had no more than a second to brace himself before the beast came sliding out at full speed with no way to stop.

As the beast fell it screamed which almost caused James to lose his grip, hanging on by sheer power of will. It seemed to take an eternity for the monster to hit the water but when it did James was rewarded by a huge splash. Just as he was about to swing back into the drain he noticed that instead of floating the creature was dissolving in the water. Dismissing it as just a weird anomaly he climbed back into the drain pipe and collapsed on the floor and just lay there breathing heavily for the next five minutes.

When he was ready to go he stood up and began to slowly make his way back to where he had seen the hatch. As he walked he noticed that there was a stairway on his right that led back up in to the complex into an important looking room.
1111121211112.title: Flee

11111212111121.content:
James decided to take the stairs as the room could be useful. James could not have been more right as he stepped off of the top of the stairs and stepped into the backup surveillance and operations room for the entire compound.

"Well this could be useful" James said to no one in particular as he approached the main console and sat down in the main operator’s chair. As he sat a thick cloud of dust formed around James and he began to cough, what was more confusing for James was that all of the key pads had a thick layer of dust on them from not being used in at least a month, James scowled as the answer to why they would not have been able to make it to a perfectly good command room eluded him.

Shrugging off the matter he pressed the main power button and everything in the room began to power up, within seconds James had all of the camera views up and was going through them individually on the center monitor. Within minutes he had two camera views on the main monitor: one showed a group of ATHER members moving through the complex, while the second one showed a view of Felicha pacing a room and as he panned he noticed that the hatch was dented in a bit.

"Son of a bitch!" James swore excitedly "She IS in there!"

James pulled himself back to the hard decision he had to make, who to contact first.
11111212111121.title: Take the Stairs

111112121111211.content:
James knew that Felicha would not be going anywhere due to the fact that the door she was trapped behind was pretty fucked and would not be opening without the "assistance" of high explosives.

James scanned the panel and found the switch for the compound intercom and flipped it

"ATHER troopers this is Sergeant James Anderson team ECHO commanding, come in." As James spoke he watched as the leader held up a clenched fist, the hand signal for stop and then spread his hand out holding up five fingers, the signal for spread out before speaking.

"Sergeant Anderson" he spoke his voice heavy with suspicion "Is that really you?"

"Authentication code Echo, Lima, 0036256" James replied in an authoritative voice

"My god it really is him" one of the other soldiers spoke in a state of awe

"Walters" the leader responded in a sharp voice

"Yes sir" Walters replied

"Shut up!" the leader barked

"Yes sir" Walters replied, clearly submissive this time.

"Trooper!" James interrupted sharply "Report"

"Yes sir" the trooper complied “Sir we were part of team DELTA, our orders were to get in here and secure one of the suspected armouries in the compound Sir”
“Continue” James commanded
“Yes Sir” the trooper replied his voice starting to quaver “When we got to the location it wasn’t an armoury it was some kind of shrine sir”
“What happened Trooper” James pressed
“Well Sir we were attacked, the Lieutenant had just ordered us to do a sweep of the room after Walters here found a strange book. The forward elements of our unit had just started to report something strange when a huge creature attacked us Sir”
“Define huge Trooper I’ve seen a couple of big ones myself” James ordered shivering at the memories of the creature with no eyes and the one with the tentacles.
“Sir this thing was: massive at least twenty feet tall, it had skin like tar, wings on its back, its eyes were blood red, its teeth were the size of a man and its claws were twice as big” fear started to enter the trooper’s voice.
“OK trooper calm down, what’s your name?” James asked
“Sanderson, Corporal Sanderson Sir” Sanderson replied calming down
“OK Sanderson standby” James replied as he tapped the keypad looking for and finding the DELTA survivors position “Sanderson you and your team are on sub level six section five, I am on sub level five section two I want you and your team to haul ass to my position ASAP.”
“But Sir” Sanderson asked “how are we supposed to get to you if we don’t know where you are?”
“Don’t worry Sanderson the complex surveillance systems have you pinpointed and are tracking you, also I have a map of the complex so I will guide you to my position.”
“Understood Sir we’re Oscar Mike”
111112121111211.title: ATHER troopers

1111121211112111.content:
James continued to monitor the DELTA survivors as Sanderson took point and lead the other two soldiers down the hall and towards his position. As James watched more he began to see great leadership potential in the young corporal.

On a whim he typed Sanderson's name into the computer just to see what was in the system, much to James's surprise it popped up with a complete service record showing: what battles he had fought in during his military career, what medals he had received, where he had grown up and who all of his family was.

"What the fuck" James breathed as his eyes scanned the screen soaking up the details, at first he thought that it might be espionage but that got put to rest when he found all the proper code keys on the document, his next thought was that maybe Sanderson was a traitor but that was also put to rest when he searched up his own name and found a complete service record for himself on the mainframe.

His next thought was that it was a mole sneaking information, but that was put to rest due to the fact that the info was too complete to have been smuggled out of a government building.

As James rapidly scanned his eyes back and forth over the screen he became so caught up that he did not hear the sound of foot steps behind him, by the time he heard the noise it was too late, all he had time to do activate the locator in his radio and hope for the best before the pipe hit him in the side of the head and darkness followed.
1111121211112111.title: Continue

11111212111121111.content:
Sannderson and the others came to a four-way junktion."Now wsich way James?"He asked the air."James?"He asked agian when he got no reply. "Ramirez, wilks get ready.." he said to the other two.
Ramirez was delta's heavy weapons expert which is why he chose a SAW for his weapon along with a M9 piston as back up if something happened to Sanderson he would take of comand being a Lance corporal.

Wilks was a little guy but wost called him rook do to this being his first real mission, and some mission it turned out to be, the squade was probly dead and rook was scared out of his mind, hell they all were. some how Sanderson had managed to calm him down enough to stay with themm. which was good cause the SPAS-12 he ahd chose for his gun would come in handy. he was also the only one carrying gernades out of the three. Sanderson cracked a smile at the thought that the Rook had been the only one to think to grab any.

"ok you two we seem to have lsot contack with James for now so we're on our own agian. the objective is the same though, tey and meet up at were James was understood."

"Yes, sir" Ramirez and the rook answered at the same time.

Sanderson nodded, they were ready as they would ever be.
11111212111121111.title: Sanderson's POV

111112121111211111.content:
Sanderson tried the radio one more time and cursed as his radio emitted a loud sharp burst of screeching static. He grasped the knob with thumb and forefinger and violently twisted it to the off position. He signaled Walters to watch back down the hall so nothing could jump them, and then he signaled Ramirez to come to his position. The burly corporal slung his SAW and crouched beside Sanderson

"Yes" he whispered not saying sir because they were both the same rank, Ramirez had just never raised an issue when Sanderson began to issue orders.

"What do you think of this comm silence?" Sanderson questioned

"It is weird" Ramirez admitted "but then again everything else in this place is weird, so why should this be any different"

"True" Sanderson agreed "but what the fuck are we supposed to do now, after all without Sergeant Anderson to guide us we have to stay put"

"Maybe" Ramirez replied "or maybe not"

"What do you mean?" Sanderson demanded

From his assault vest he withdrew what looked like a block of C4 but what turned out to be a small tracker that picked up on radio transmissions. As soon as Ramirez pointed the device in the direction they needed to go it lit up with a signal, strong and bright.

"Ok let’s get going" Sanderson ordered in his most authoritative voice and began to move down the hall, he got three steps before the rookie burst out laughing and Ramirez spoke

"Not so fast Captain America" he replied with a big shit eating grin on his face.

"Ok Bevis and Butthead!" Sanderson replied hotly, "Why shouldn’t we move?"

"Because I've picked up a second signal" Ramirez spoke while trying not to laugh, clearly amused by the whole situation.

"What’s the second signal then wise ass?" Sanderson questioned "Actually come to think of it, what’s the first signal?"

"Can't tell you" Ramirez replied "all I can tell you is that the stronger signal is coming from a base station, like the ones used in a comm or surveillance room and the weaker signal is almost certainly coming from a handheld radio"

Sanderson tried to contact both of the signals only to be met by screeching static both times he turned his radio on. "Great so basically we are flying blind no matter which way we go" Sanderson growled

"Basically" Ramirez summed up.
111112121111211111.title: contiue.

1111121211112111111.content:
"Can you guarantee that you can maintain a lock on the weaker signal?" Sanderson questioned

"No, not really" Ramirez replied unhelpfully

"Great" Sanderson groaned "alright we'll go to the stronger signal, Walters your on point, Ramirez rear guard and I'll be in the center" Sanderson ordered as he gripped his P90 tighter.

Walters moved to the front, raised his SPAS 12 and began to move. Sanderson fell in behind him scanning over everything the rookie did just in case, Ramirez followed up in the back sweeping his big SAW back and forth.

As they continued to move toward the signal they turned into a particularly messy hallway.

"Spread out" Sanderson commanded "Use the cover but check your corners"

As the three soldiers began to move down the hall they began to hear monstrous foot falls

thud, THud, THUD

Sanderson dove for cover and motioned for Ramirez and Walters to do the same. As they ducked down a big beast came around the corner: it was covered in blood, missing an arm, and it had no eyes just empty sockets.
1111121211112111111.title: Signal One

11111212111121111111.content:
As the three soldiers ducked low to avoid detection Sanderson withdrew a fibre optic cable, powered it on and snaked it around the edge of his cover. On the monitor he saw the eyeless monster start sniffing like a dog trying to find a place to shit.

Sanderson withdrew the cable, and then he signalled across the way to Ramirez and Walters. In hand signals he told Ramirez to lay down suppression fire on the beast with his SAW, then he told Walters to chuck grenades at the thing until it died or until he ran out of grenades, and lastly he told them to wait for his go order to attack.

Next he took out a block of his C4 and slid it into the center of the hall, just in case and if they didn't need it he could always slip out the arming pin and use it again later. Finally everything was ready, the trap was set.

Sanderson waited a second then gave the go signal. Instantly Ramirez rose to a crouch and began to fire his SAW in short controlled bursts, while Walters stood up behind him and began to throw grenades at the beast.

The beast never had a chance, with any lighter of a weapon it would have shrugged it off but the sheer volume and power of the SAW's 5.56X45mm rounds tore through its body and ravaged it, then the first grenade landed and blew chunks of the thing sky high.

As the three battle weary troopers stepped out from behind their respective covers each of their reactions told a little bit about the man underneath: Sanderson mopped his forehead with his sleeve and smiled at the fact that the men were safe, Ramirez slung his SAW over his shoulder and smiled at the chunks of still steaming meat over the floor, and Walters fell against the nearest wall and slid down it.
Sanderson turned to Ramirez and clasped his hand and shook it, and then together they moved to Walters each taking one of his hands and pulling him up
“Come on soldier” Sanderson growled “We’re not out of this yet”
As they moved away from the battle zone Ramirez slapped a fresh magazine into his SAW and Walters slipped his remaining grenades back into his belt pouches.
11111212111121111111.title: Continue

111112121111211111111.content:
As they walked away from the combat zone Sanderson tried his radio again, no screeching this time just dead air on both signals. Just as Sanderson was about to turn off his radio when he heard a faint echo of a voice and it sounded female. Curious he flicked the selector knob on his radio until he could hear the voice clearly, as he got to the right channel the voice spoke again leaving no doubt in Sanderson's mind that not only was the voice female, but that she was in trouble.

"This is Private first class Felicha Mennen" She whispered "if anybody can hear this I need immediate assistance"

Sanderson started before she could speak again "This is Lance corporal Todd Sanderson acting commander ATHER team DELTA code in Private" Sanderson didn't know this PFC Mennen but that wasn't unusual as the individual teams usually kept to themselves but if she passed the code in then he could trust her.

"Echo, Mike, Foxtrot, 0287569" Felicha replied breathlessly

Sanderson paused for a second as he recalled the code in passwords that he had been made to memorize for the mission, her's checked out.

"OK Mennen I'm listening, what is it you need" Sanderson stated

"What I need is help Corporal, I was trapped in a room but I blasted my way out of it and now I'm on the run because something is chasing me, I'm holed up now but it’s only a matter of time before whatever’s out there catches up to me" Felicha hissed at him

"OK, Ok, ok just calm down" Sanderson soothed "just hang in there long enough for us to get to the surveillance room and then we'll come get you"

"OK, thank you I'll try to hang in as long as I possibly can" Felicha replied getting some of her wind back in the process

"Good we'll be there in a bit" Sanderson replied "Oh and one more thing"

"Yes" Felicha answered

"Turn on your locator beacon" Sanderson ordered

"Done" Felicha replied then the channel went dead

"Ramirez?" Sanderson questioned as he looked over his shoulder

"Got her" Ramirez replied

"OK good let’s keep moving on" Sanderson ordered "the surveillance room should be just up ahead"

"Wait" Walters interjected "why aren’t we going to rescue her first?"

"Ok kid first off: don't question orders, second I don't know what movie you think is but we are going to need up to the minute intelligence, and third having someone in the surveillance room will be very useful to us anyway." Sanderson replied with quiet resolution in his voice

"So wait, who stays in the surveillance room then?" Walters questioned

"You" Sanderson and Ramirez replied in unison, Sanderson with steel in his voice and Ramirez with amusement.

"Why me!" Walters complained

"Because you have the least combat experience so you'll just slow us down, you'll be monitoring the cameras to give us up to date information, and you’re starting to annoy me so I'd like to spend some time away from you" Sanderson bit out "Happy now?"

Walters took the hint and shut up, just when they were a few feet from the surveillance room an overhead pipe came loose from its mountings and struck Ramirez square across the back.

The worst part wasn't the pipe striking it was the little spiders from hell that came pouring out from it, Walters was in the fray instantly: pushing, punching, and shooting the spiders away from Ramirez’s prone form. Sanderson rushed up to Walters

"Get him inside the room I'll hold these fuckers off!" Sanderson shouted

Wordlessly Walters slung his SPAS and began to drag Ramirez across the floor to the open door, Sanderson fired and fired, pouring mag after mag into the little bastards but more just kept coming. Finally after what seemed like an eternity Walters hollered

"IN!"

Sanderson fired one last burst, then turned sprinted for the door and dived in at the last second having Walters slam it and lock it behind him. Both men sat panting and gasping for breath for a long while. Once they felt physically up to it they dragged Ramirez’s unconscious form into the room, which Sanderson found out served as a backup command room and shelter for the compound.

Having wrapped Ramirez up in blankets and given him a bit of food and water from the emergency supplies Sanderson moved to leave the room to get Felicha.

"What about me" Walters called "am I coming with you"

Sanderson thought about it: on the one hand it would be nice to have backup, but on the other he did need someone to watch over Ramirez, feed him info, and wait for Sergeant Anderson in case he did show up.
111112121111211111111.title: Continue with Sanderson

1111121211112111111111.content:
Eventually after mulling it over Sanderson replied

"No Walters I need you to stay here and provide me with up to the minuet tactical data, not to mention look after Ramirez until he wakes up, understood?"

"Yes Sir" Walters replied obediently

As Sanderson turned to leave Walters noticed something on the monitors

"Sir, Sir Look at this Sir!" Walters cried excitedly

"What is it Walters" Sanderson replied as he move to stand in front of the monitor. Walters did not need to answer however as Sanderson saw it clearly even if he didn't understand it, two people with bulky black power armour and helmets were on sublevel one and steadily pushing their way down, killing anything that got in their way. "Can you establish communications with them Walters?" Sanderson asked after a moment of silence.

"Umm..." Walters trailed off as he searched the banks of controls looking for the one that he wanted "yes, comms established"

"Who is this?" a Slavic accented female voice questioned "identify yourself now!" she demanded

"This is Corporal Todd Sanderson acting commander ATHER team DELTA, now identify yourself" he replied

"This is special agent Snegurockha, USOWB" Snegurockha answered

"Snegurockha what kind of name is that?" Sanderson questioned

"It is my code name, and it is all that you will get from me!" Snegurockha snapped


"Let me guess" Sanderson replied completely unfazed "classified"

"Yes it is!" Snegurockha snarled

"I thought so" Sanderson replied coolly

"Wait...how are you contacting us?" Snegurockha started "I didn't think your radios had the range."

"They don't" Sanderson admitted "but we are contacting you from the backup command center on sublevel six"

"Wait, you mean you have a strong point?" Snegurockha questioned

"Yes we do" Sanderson confirmed

"Alright we will rendezvous with you at the command center" Snegurockha stated

"Sounds good" Sanderson replied "Sanderson out" then he closed the link.

"So Sir" Walters started "what’s the plan"

"The plan private is that you stay here: to watch over Ramirez, feed me up to date Intel and to greet our new arrivals" Sanderson answered

"While you do what Sir?" Walters asked

"Find Sergeant Anderson" Sanderson answered "and PFC Mennen" and with that he was out of the hatch and had it locked.
1111121211112111111111.title: Leave without Walters

11111212111121111111111.content:
With a sharp knife of pain James regained consciousness, as his blurry vision swam into focus he saw the floor moving below him but his feet were not doing the walking. It was then that James realized that he was being dragged along by two other men. He tried to stagger to his feet but was rewarded for his trouble with a rifle butt to his midsection, he wheezed in pain as the wind was knocked out of him and the guards resumed dragging him.

As the unlikely trio rounded the bend James noticed a large blast door similar to others he had seen about the compound except that it was more ornately decorated and guarded by a pair of guards who snapped to attention as the trio approached.

"Prisoner to see the Colonel" The guard who had drove the butt of his rifle into James's midsection stated in a stiff voice

The guard on the right side of the door nodded and moved to slide a key card into a card reader while the guard on the left continued to stand at attention. The right side guard finished sliding the card through and resumed his stance as the massive door began to split apart and slide back into the walls.

James and as he called his two guards in his head Mutt and Jeff moved through the now expansive opening and into a bright well light room. James grunted in pain as his eyes had become accustomed to nothing more than dim emergency lighting, the glare was blinding so he shut his eyes with a watery wince.

Jeff who had just about burst his insides apart with the butt of his rifle laughed at his discomfort. Mutt who had not uttered a word for the duration of the trip continued to say nothing and simply stared ahead at what James's adjusted eyes could now make out as a military checkpoint.

Jeff looked up and hastily snapped to attention and saluted at someone outside of James's view. The way Jeff saluted with his hand touching his forehead kicked up a red flag in James's mind, only Americans saluted that way.

With this crucial bit of information fresh in his mind he looked upon the checkpoint with a fresh set of eyes: the guard's weapons were M4's and M16's the type of guns used by American forces, the camouflage was ACU the type used by American forces, and while there was no unit patches or rank badges he could still see the Velcro patches of where they used to be.

All of this added up to one thing in James's mind he was being detained by American soldiers, his own side!
11111212111121111111111.title: Continue with James

choices: Continue with James as he learns the truth
Go to Sanderson as he sets out to save Felicha
111112121111211111111111.content:
As James struggled to come to grips with this shocking revelation a voice full of authority began to tear Mutt and Jeff new assholes

"So let me get this straight Private you attacked this man without provocation, dragged him through the halls like a sack of meat and then dump him in our base of operations knowing full well that he was an American counter terrorist team leader just doing his job" the voice asked deadly quiet

"W-we-well not exactly doing his job sir" Jeff stammered

"Oh by all means please explain then Private" the voice replied, never raising nor lowering just steadiness

Jeff gulped "Well Colonel he was poking around in the computer systems and I saw the documents on the monitor sir, he knew-"

"No" the Colonel cut Jeff off "he suspected but he never knew anything for sure but now he knows our biggest secret as he listened in on our entire conversation"

James felt his guts knot up and saw Jeff's face go white as he spun towards James, his rifle's butt raised. James shut his eyes and prepared for the blow that never came

"Stand down soldier" the Colonel spoke as he gripped the butt of Jeff's rifle. Jeff immediately relaxed and slung his rifle his eyes glaring daggers at James

"Private, you and Private Sonners report to lieutenant Jargens for disciplinary action" the Colonel ordered Jeff

"Sir yes sir!" Jeff barked as he and Mutt saluted in unison spun on their heels and marched from the room

"I'm sorry about that son" the Colonel apologized "I'm Colonel Baird, if you follow me to my office I'll tell you everything I'm sure you want to know."
111112121111211111111111.title: Continue

1111121211112111111111111.content:
Baird pulled James to his feet and cut the binders that had been keeping his wrists bound for over an hour, as James massaged his sore wrists Baird pointed to a door at the end of a hall directly after the checkpoint

"My office is that door at the end of the hall whenever you’re ready" Baird stated

James rose to the challenge and rose to his feet, as Baird moved to lead the way James could have sworn he had a smile on his face. As they finally reached the office James noticed: a retinal scanner, a palm scanner, and a voice scanner all built into the reinforced concrete wall next to a solid five inch thick steel door.

Baird stepped up to the door: put his eye against the retinal scanner, placed his palm on the palm reader and spoke into the voice scanner

"Colonel Joshua Baird, code word black birch"

The door hummed as the computer processed the information, then three thunks were heard as the three locks disengaged and the door swung inward.

Baird stepped into the room and sat behind his desk while James opted to stand, the door slid outward on perfectly balanced, oiled hinges. As it slid shut James heard the sound of the locks thunking back into place.

The silence that followed seemed to stretch on for hours; Baird was the one who broke it

"So what are your questions?" he put bluntly

"Where is my gear?" James asked just as bluntly

"Your gear is in one of our storage rooms and will be given back to you when you are ready to leave" Baird replied sincerely

"Ok" James replied "what the fuck is going on here Colonel?" he blurted out

Baird laughed for a second and then composed himself "Perhaps it would be better if you hold your questions and I tell you what has happened here" Baird suggested

James motioned for him to continue....
1111121211112111111111111.title: Continue with James as he learns the truth

11111212111121111111111111.content:
"All right, but I do need to tell you one thing for this all to make sense first" Baird stated

"Please do Colonel" James replied

"Well from what your Commander told you, you must think that this is some kind of cult, am I correct?" Baird questioned

"How do you know that, that information is-" James started

"Classified" Baird interrupted "this is really a government funded black operation Anderson; we have a monopoly on information"

"Oh my god" James whispered

"Anyway" Baird continued "it was about eight hours ago when this all started"

"When all of what started?" James asked

"All of the monsters from hell infesting the base of course" Baird answered

"How did that happen?" James asked

"Well you see the whole point of this experiment was to see if the United States could harness the power of the occult and use it to our advantage"

"Look how well that turned out" James remarked "but I am confused as to why the government would invest time and money into something that was thought not to exist?" he asked

"Actually the government was aware of the occult’s existence long before this incident" Baird answered

"How so?" James asked

"During the invasion of Berlin during World war two the Russians invaded Berlin before American forces" Baird started

"That is common knowledge" James continued

"What is not common knowledge" Baird replied "Is that a small unit of American Special Forces infiltrators were already in Berlin, more specifically inside the Reich Chancellery"

"Ok I'll bite" James said "what were they doing"

"They were stealing a book" Baird finished

James was about to ask what book it was but he already knew, it was the same book that was causing all of the horrors he had seen and fought over the past hours. Despite all that James had learned he still had a few more questions for Baird.

"So how do you have all of the information on me and my people?" He asked

"When we learned about the raid it was only a few hours before it happened" Baird sighed remembering the past "we still figured that we needed to know everything we could get about our adversaries, hence we flash copied all of the personnel files and battle plans to our mainframe even though we never got the chance to use them" Baird commented ruefully.

"Why do you have so few soldiers?" James asked having noted the lack of security beforehand

"Because of your forces and a dammed fool technician" Baird ground out sounding angry now "I had stationed two squads up top at the gate, and another five squads on the lower levels guarding the book because that was our one standing order 'If ever under attack send half of your security to guard the book' well what a stupid order that was, when the tech finally managed to unleash the book's power it sent out a pulse mutating all of the personnel on that level plus the five security squads."

"Oh Jesus" James whispered

"After that" Baird continued "I retreated, with half of my security mutated and another two squads dead I took my remaining three squads and holed up in this emergency bunker where we've been ever since"
11111212111121111111111111.title: The Truth

111112121111211111111111111.content:
James opened his mouth to speak but nothing came out in his state of his shock, Baird's recounting of the last few hours seemed to fill in all of the gaps in his own knowledge. In the silence that followed Baird spoke again

"Although I suppose holing up in this bunker just merely gives us time to make our peace with god"

"What do you mean?" James replied disheartened at Colonel Baird's pessimistic outlook

"What I mean is that by this time tomorrow everybody will be dead" Baird sighed with the mood of a man resigned to his death

"Well with all due respect sir I think that you're wrong and that we can survive this" James replied confidently

"Don't be a fool Anderson!" Baird shouted, startling James "Between the mutated freaks out there and our own forces we will die, it’s only a matter of when" finished Baird slumped into his chair, a defeated man.

"Wait sir back up, what do you mean our own forces?" James questioned

"The USOWB, or to be precise the United States Occult Warfare Bureau"

"What do they do?" James questioned


"They contain and clean up all of America's Occult messes, in addition they make sure that there are no witnesses" Baird practically hissed the last part out

"If they leave no witnesses then how do you know so much about them?" James asked becoming more and more suspicious by the minute

"Because when I was given command of this project I was briefed on them and what their response would be in the event of an outbreak" Baird muttered a haunted look in his eyes.

"What is the response Colonel?" James asked, his voice deadly quiet

"Complete sterilization of the complex via the failsafe protocol" The colonel finished

James took a moment to digest all of this before asking

"What is the failsafe protocol?"

"On the bottom level of this complex is a small nuclear reactor which provides power to the entire complex, however on this generator is a control pad that when the correct sequence of numbers is input it creates a feedback loop changing it from reactor to nuclear bomb” Baird answered

“How do they intend to do that?” James asked incredulity “I don’t know if they noticed but the halls are infested with the spawn of Satan himself”

“I have no doubt that they have already sent in two of their special agents, in which case they will progress to the generator rather rapidly while killing everything in their way, friend or foe alike”

“What makes them so special?” James asked not really believing what he was hearing

“Aside from their occult training they have had the best training and technology that the advances of time and the flow of taxpayer money can provide, for instance their magnificent black power armour” Baird answered

“So what else do you know about these special agents then?” James questioned

“Just the codenames of the two agents assigned to this facility: Snegurockha and Sanford
111112121111211111111111111.title: Continue

1111121211112111111111111112.content:
James leaned back in his chair speaking as he did so

"So we have black op soldiers running around this facility killing everything they see, friend and foe alike and their power armour prevents us from killing them."

"In a word" Baird replied "yes"

"Well then our course of action has been decided for us then" James stated

"And that would be" Baird bristled not accustomed to having his actions dictated to him by a sergeant

"We need to regroup with my personnel, rearm in your armoury and fight our way out of here" James replied bluntly

Baird leaned back in his own chair and said nothing for the longest time, finally after an eternity he spoke

"You realize that would mean killing fellow soldiers, don't you Sergeant."

James gulped and almost lost his nerve; if Baird arrested him for treason down here he might just throw him to whatever those things were out there. After a second's pause James spoke calmly as ever

"With all due respect Sir it’s a kill or be killed situation out there sir."

"Ok" Baird sighed admitting defeat "let’s do it"

"Yes sir!" James replied practically jumping to his feet

"How long will it take to contact your troops and get them assembled here" Baird continued

"Do you have any communications gear that can interface with their radios?" James asked

"Of course" Baird replied without hesitation

"Then it should only take a couple of hours Sir"

"Well then get to it Sergeant" Baird commanded

"Yes Sir!" James barked as he snapped to and then left the room
1111121211112111111111111112.title: Stay with James

11111212111121111111111111121.content:
The sun was mere moments away from cresting the ridge that had effectively isolated the government compound, the birds chirped and the crickets finished up their songs. Just then when all seemed peaceful three Blackhawk helicopters roared up over the ridge shattering the early morning peace and silence.

In the lead chopper Major Cliff Harkin poured over the latest report to come from the topside containment team. Sitting opposite of him were: Lieutenant Richards head of the army contingent that had been called up and Director Ed Tillmen of the CDC who had been ordered personally by the present to make sure that the site remained quarantined. Sitting besides Harkin was his aide Lieutenant Michael Higgins who had served him loyally for a little over four years.

"Major" Higgins said

"Yes, what is it?" Harkin replied

"Perhaps you should brief them Sir"

"Perhaps I should" Harkin continued utterly unfazed that they could hear everything he was saying "Thank you lieutenant"

"Sir" Higgins answered

"Gentlemen" Harkin spoke indicating the Director and the lieutenant

The lieutenant snapped to attention despite being belted into his seat and saluted, the Director simply nodded

Harkin returned the Director's nod but brushed off the lieutenant’s salute "At ease Richards, we'll be doing things more informally from now on"

"Sir" Richards replied while he dropped his salute and relaxed

"Major" the director spoke up "I'm confused, what do you mean by we?"

"Patience Director, all of your questions will be answered in due time" Harkin replied

The Director fell silent and waited for Harkin to continue

“Now then” Harkin started “I arranged to have you brought on the same helicopter as me to lay down the law”

Richards and Tliiman exchanged puzzled glances before looking back at him

“I wanted to let you know that even though I have the fewest units from my branch here that I have command over the combined forces here both army and CDC, the president has given me complete autonomy here.”

Richards spoke up “Sir with all due respect where are your units, I’ve had my units reporting in twenty four seven and not once have they mentioned any new arrivals except for a black truck whose driver presented top level clearance.”

Harkin grinned “Two of my soldiers were in that truck, the top level clearance is because the serve in my unit and the rest of my soldiers are in the right side Blackhawk, my Intel experts as well as my second in command are on the left side Blackhawk.

As Richards fell silent Tillman spoke up “What is your unit Major?”

“What do you mean director?” Harkin asked

“I mean that you have gone on and on about your unit but you haven’t told us anything about it” the Director answered in a defiant manner

Higgins tensed ready to rip the Director a new asshole however Harkin held out his arm in front of his aide while at the same time speaking out to the Director

“Director Tillman my apologies for not specifying my unit, my unit is called the United States Occult Warfare Bureau and you’d best show some respect when talking to its C.O.
11111212111121111111111111121.title: Topside

111112121111211111111111111211.content:
The reactions were nothing short of amazing as Richards sharply inhaled and Tillman's face actually lost its color turning a ghostly shade of white. Tillman started to stammer out an apology but Harkin cut him off with a clenched fist

"No need to apologize Director just remember that I run the show here, understood?" Harkin ground out

"Understood" Tillman and Richards echoed

"Good" Harkin finished

The rest of the trip was silent until they reached the staging area, as the chopper prepared to descend but abruptly it levelled out, and began to circle the area in a holding pattern.

"What the hell is going on now?" Harkin asked

"I'll find out sir" Higgins answered as he edged his way past the door gunners and entered the cockpit, moments later he remerged "Sir Flight control has issued a temporary no landing order"

"What in the hell for!" Higgins demanded

"Apparently there's been a breach of underground containment Sir" Higgins paused as there was a sharp intake of breath from Tillman and Richards "Lieutenant Richards soldiers have engaged"

Even as he said this they could see muzzle flashes on the ground, Harkin began to bark out orders regaining control over the situation

"Higgins get on the radio and tell flight control that one of our Blackhawks will come close to the deck to put boots on the ground, then tell teams Alpha and Bravo that they’re going in, and go tell the pilot that he is to descend to the altitude that our miniguns will have the greatest effect." Harkin commanded

"Yes Sir" Higgins Barked as he jumped to his assigned tasks

Minutes later the chopper began to descend again and the door gunners went to their respective positions, Higgins stepped out of the cockpit and gripped the grab bar for support. Once he sat down and belted himself back in he turned to Harkin "Sir Mission accomplished sir"

"That was fast" Harkin replied clearly impressed

"Yes Sir" Higgins answered

"Good man" Harkin complimented

"Thank you Sir" Higgins replied clearly proud, as the door gunners took their positions they flung open the doors and for the first time the four men got a good look at the situation below.

A creature had come up the shaft leading down to the base and was trying to breach containment and make it to the outside world lieutenent Richards troops were slowing it down but the thing just absorbed the bullets like a sponge and kept pushing forcing Richards troops to give ground lest they get ripped apart by the things tentacles which it flailed around like a whip.

Just then Alpha and Bravo's helicopter reached fast rope height and the two squads roped down coming up in crouches and checking their sight lines, as Bravo finished up fast roping their last man came down the rope with some difficulty however he was no ordinary soldier, he wore a huge power pack on his back which had lines leading to a large weapon that was harnessed on his chest.

"Ah yes I forgot about Bravo's new toy, but what’s it called?" Harkin asked

"That is the Plasma cannon Sir" Higgins answered

"Right I want to see this thing in action, have Alpha take backstop and put Bravo on point." Harkin ordered

"Yes Sir" Higgins answered and began to mutter orders into his radio. Once he finished he saluted them as a sign of respect, then turned and headed to the CP.

As he opened the door everybody in the room rose and saluted him with the exception of Tillman and the man sitting next to him. Harkin returned the salute and then motioned for everybody to sit, everybody included: First Lt Richards and his second in command, Harkin's own second in command Captain Raymus, his Intel officer Second Lt. Daris, Director Tillman and his second in command, and a stranger who wore a uniform that he could not place, there was also a large plasma screen that took up one entire wall.

"Well let me begin by asking who the hell that is?" Harkin asked pointing at the stranger, Daris spoke up

"Sir this is Captian Salen, the Commander of ATHER"

"Is that so" Harkin said stareing at Salen "So you’re the one that fucked everything up are you"

Salen stared right right back at Harkin "We acted on ligitimate evidence from a relibile source"

"Oh yeah and whose your source?" Harkin asked

"I can't give you that information Major" Salen answered

“Classified is my word Salen, now tell me who your source is” Harkin growled

“I mean that literally Major, I cannot give you that information because the person who called it in was anonymous” Salen replied “but I did not come here to defend my actions Major, I came to help you in resolving this matter”

“Explain yourself Captain” Harkin commanded

“I have the access codes that with a proper transmission will be able to remotely access any ATHER personnel helmet cameras and transponders”

“I assume that you have turned all of this data over to Lieutenant Daris?” Harkin asked bluntly

“Yes I have” Salen replied

“Good then your job is finished, come with me and I’ll escort you to your helicopter” Harkin commanded indicating the door

“Gladly” Salen grunted walking towards the door, Harkin motioned for Raymus and Higgins to follow and together the four of them left the command post.

Outside of the post the foursome headed towards the ATHER chopper, as Salen drew closer he saw his pilots who were doing their pre-flight checklists suddenly get grabbed from behind by USOWB commandos, seeing this he spun around only to see Harkin pointing a pistol at his face a heartbeat later Harkin fired.

As the shot rang out across the courtyard the Command post’s door slammed open as Richards and the rest ran across to where Harkin was standing. Harkin holstered his handgun as he looked down at the lifeless corpse of Salen, then Richards was on scene handgun drawn and ready

“Sir what the hell is going on here?” Richards questioned

Ignoring Richards Harkin turned to Raymus “Assemble a team to dump the chopper and bodies in the lake” Harkin ordered

“Yes Sir” Raymus acknowledged, then turned and jogged off to the USOWB choppers

“Sir what is going on here” Richards persisted

“Forget about it Richards, it’s too high above your pay grade” Harkin warned

“But Sir I reall-“Richards started but Harkin finally lost it with him so he grabbed him by his collar and slammed him into the chopper

“Shut. The. Fuck. Up” Harkin ground out as he gripped him tighter “Stop asking questions or you’ll end up like them” he bit out his face flushed as he pointed to the bodies on the chopper, he then let go and walked back to the CP with Higgins and Daris on his heels.

Back in the command post once everybody was seated again Harkin spoke “Before we use these codes I want to issue a standing kill order for any ATHER personnel, is that understood Richards?” Harkin asked

Richards looked like he was about to object, but when Harkin sent him a look that could have blasted through power armour the only words that came out of his mouth were “Yes Sir”

“Good answer Lieutenant” Harkin replied “Now Lieutenant Daris establish a connection so we can use the codes” Harkin ordered

“Yes Sir” Daris responded and tapped on his data pad a minute later he established contact with Snegurockha

“Yes Major” She answered

“Snegurockha we need to use you as a comm relay hold your position.”

“Yes Sir, will comply, out” and went silent off the channel but not off the comm

Harkin once again turned to Daris “Use the codes”

“Yes Sir” Daris replied and fed the codes into his data pad, a minute later a result popped up “Sir we have something it’s a helmet camera”

“Very well, Play it” Harkin ordered

The silence in the room was complete as Harkin and the others digested what they had just witnessed; finally Harkin broke the silence by exhaling loudly. "Alright people that footage illustrates perfectly why we need to go down there right now and activate the failsafe device" He spoke as he pointed to the withering mass of insects paused on screen "because if we don't they will breach containment and show this world an unimaginable horror the likes of which have never before been witnessed."

"Sir" Richards spoke with absolute conviction in his voice "If your boys will be the vanguard then my boys will back them up to the best of their abilities demons be damned sir!"

"And if Lieutenant Richards men are going down then my men will help you activate the failsafe and purge this threat one and for all!" Tillman spoke as he stood and moved to Richards's side

"Yes Major" Tillman replied as he turned to leave but Harkin brought him up short

11111212111121111111111111121111111.content:
Harkin sat in a slight defocus for a few seconds before regaining his senses; the only other person in the room was Daris his intelligence and technical chief who was engrossed in his data pad having sat out the entire conversation. "Daris could you get me a link to Eagle One and give me the room"

"Yes Sir just give me a second" Daris answered as he began to tap on his data pad, while he was doing this the plasma screen was flashing SEARCHING CONNECTION... Daris spent a few more minutes tapping on his data pad before uttering "Done" and leaving the room. On the plasma it now read CONNECTION ESTABLISHED... before resolving itself into the vague features of a man whose face was obscured in shadow.

"Major Harkin" The unmistakable voice of President William Bowers came over the speakers "You have something to report I assume"

"Yes Sir" Harkin answered as he started to sweat "the ATHER neutralization is nearly complete" he spoke more confidently as he brought up the results from the most recent sweep "We have eliminated over seventy five percent of their combat, logistical, and intelligence personnel; Colonel Salen is dead as are his helicopter pilots and command crew. Aside from a few sniper teams that we are hunting through the woods as we speak the only other ATHER forces are in the underground facility."

"What about their headquarters at Bragg?" Bowers questioned

"Under the direct control of USOWB forces and guarded by regular army units as we speak" Harkin reported

"Very good I want you to finish up here and then head back to their headquarters and oversee your forces personally"

"Yes Sir I will get this wrapped up as soon as possible sir" Harkin replied obediently

"See that you do; Oh and Major"

"Yes Sir?" Harkin asked

"I want this to be very clean major, do you understand me" Bowers’ voice leaving no doubt that the last part was not a question but an order

"Yes Sir" Harkin replied with the only two words he could

"Good Eagle One out" And with that the screen went black; Harkin not wasting another second walked out of the room and into the early morning sun.

111112121111211111111111111211111111.content:
As Harkin walked up to the prep area he saw: Alpha and Bravo squads arming and armouring up, Richards fifteen soldiers clustered around a second table doing the exact same thing and Tillman's two specialists standing off to the side having from the looks of it a very animated conversation. Harkin needed to get everybody focused on him and fast "Platoon!" He hollered "Attention!"

At once Alpha and Bravo immediately stopped what they were doing and stood at attention, Richards soldiers took a bit longer, and Tillman's geeks just stared at him. Both Alpha and Bravo squad leaders removed their helmets and snapped off precision salutes before proceeding to debrief him on what had gone on during his absence. “Sir Alpha squad is combat ready” Sergeant Silis reported

“Sir Bravo squad is one hundred percent sir” Sergeant Vadock reported in

“Both of you at ease” Harkin commanded

“Yes Sir” Silis and Vadock answered in unison as they lowered their arms to their sides

“Now then here is what we are going to do” Harkin spoke as he began to explain his battle plan “Alpha, Bravo, and Richards’ unit will take the lift down to the first sublevel; Alpha and Bravo will then fight their way down to sublevel five while Richards’ men serve as rear guard and keep the door open for you, on sublevel five you will find the surviving ATHER members strong point as confirmed to us by Special Agents Snegurockha and Sanford I want you to kill all of them” Harkin spoke the last line with an audible chill while leaving it in the air long enough to sink in

“Yes Sir, and after that” Vadock broke the silence

“After that you will proceed to the reactor sublevel where Tillman’s specialists will arm the fail safe option and set it to count down, following that you will then head back up towards sublevel seven to retrieve a book of vital importance to the USOWB, then while Bravo retrieves the book Alpha will head to fallout bunker two mike where you will find the pitiful remnants of the facility’s original security forces you must wipe them out; then and only then can you return to the lift for extraction, is that understood?” Harkin finished

“Sir Yes Sir!” both sergeants thundered

“Good then get yourselves and your men equipped well before you head down; dismissed”

Both men saluted, replaced their helmets, turned on their heels and marched off towards their respective squads to oversee the final equipment checks. Minutes later the checks finished and Richards’ men already on the lift Alpha and Bravo marched on to the lift with Bravo’s plasma cannon soldier bringing up the rear with his enormous power pack and the cannon itself.

“Private what is your name?” Harkin asked as the soldier was about to get on the lift

“Sir my name is Benjamin Lake” Lake replied back with a trace of nervousness

“Well Private Lake good luck down there” Harkin spoke

"Only five floors left make ready!" he called out, however the instruction was unnecessary, like the elite soldiers they were both Alpha and Bravo teams had finished their preparations five floors before.

At three floors Alpha and Bravo stacked up on either side of the elevator doors while Richards men remained in the back crouched with weapons raised at the door. Finally the readout clicked into place and the elevator doors sprung open like a bear trap only in reverse.

Alpha and Bravo sprang out of the opening sweeping the hallway with their rifles as Richards’ men flooded in behind them fanning out and establishing firing positions. Alpha team leader Silis turned to face the young lieutenant who was supervising the fortifications

“Lieutenant we’re moving out” Silis stated

“Roger that Sergeant” the Lieutenant replied confidently “don’t worry we’ll keep the door open for you guys”

“Hooah Captain America I feel so much safer with you around” Silis growled as he turned back to his squad “now then Alpha let’s leave these boys to their business” As Alpha moved down the hall they left to booming laughter.

Sergeant Vadock just: shook his head in amusement, patted the shocked lieutenant on the shoulder and ran to catch up to Alpha with the rest of Bravo behind him.
