The two squads with their CDC specialists took positions on both walls of the hall as they moved through it, Vadock and Silis on point and the rest following behind with Private Lake and his enormous plasma cannon as rear guard. The soldiers were about to hit a T-intersection, the third before their first objective when they began to hear a bizarre sound almost like ripping. At this the commandos settled into optimum firing positions and waited to see what came around the corner.

A woman in her early twenties staggered around the corner, lab coat grimy and tattered, her eyes dead and lifeless, but yet not a single scratch on her body as she continued to grope her way towards the power armoured titans. Then all at once ten Beowulfs opened up on her and the man who had appeared behind her, both were cut down without mercy. As the soldiers continued to hold their aim at the inert facedown forms one of the Privates went over to them to perform a death check, as he nudged the woman with his boot her spine suddenly burst through the skin of her back, wrapped around the unfortunate soldier and began to squeeze as hard as possible.

The poor Alpha trooper never stood a chance; even his power armour which was supposed to keep out any kind of weapons fire simply crumpled at the waist and in effect turned him into a human hour glass. By this point all of the soldiers emptied their magazines into the spine literally sawing it in half, their comrade was spurting up so much blood that his time was measured in seconds rather then minutes, being his duty as team sergeant Silis crouched beside the dying man and asked if there was anything he wanted to say to his family the soldier responded with "Tell my daughter I love her" before slumping over and dying. Silis crouched motionless over the equally motionless corpse for what seemed like an eternity before leaning forward, grabbing his dog tags, and then standing back up. He nodded to Vadock and simply said

"Let’s do this"

Vadock nodded in kind and together the two teams along with their CDC specialists fought and sprinted until they made it to the failsafe room. As soon as the last hostile was purged from the room the two CDC specs went immediately to their work, in the meantime Alpha and Bravo were both listening to their mikes when suddenly an emergency signal came over the COM

"This is army unit two Charlie we can't hold the lift be advised we can't... ahh, ahh get the fuck away-!" and the com shattered into static. Both of the sergeants exchanged a look of worry but at the same time knew that the mission had to come first.

As they walked over to the specs one of them called out "Sergeant Silis we are ready to innate detonation sequence, how much time do you want on the clock?"

"Give me a half hour" Silis replied

"Yes sir a half hour" the spec spoke up as he entered the sequence, once he was finished the red emergency lights began to flash and a large klaxon announced

"Warning thirty minutes to detonation, thirty minutes"

"Good work you two" Silis complimented as he turned to meet Vadock's eye

"Yes good work indeed" Vadock concurred "but now it's our time to get to work" Vadock spoke as he fed a fresh clip of ammunition into his rifle.

"Good luck with the Book" Silis called out as he readied his team for battle

"Yes and I wish for you to have good luck in dealing with base security" Vadock returned in kind

James was in the armoury donning the equipment that had been confiscated when he first entered the bunker. As he zipped up his vest he felt rather then heard a tremendous explosion coming from the front of the bunker. James rushed out just in time to see Jeff take a .50 cal slug in the chest as the black armoured monstrosity that shot him moved through the wreckage of the front blast door, James let the commando have it with a full burst from his CAR but the titan simply shrugged it off and returned fire.

James hit the floor as .50 cal slugs boomed over his head and took huge chunks out of the back wall. James staggered to his feet and ran back to the hall while gunfire raged all around him, once he got to cover he ran to Colonel Baird's office while the base security held off the approaching soldiers.

James all but collapsed once he made it into the Colonel's office, the only thing that stopped him was the Colonel grabbing him by the arm and moving him to the far side of the office

"You ok son?" Baird asked as he aimed his sidearm at the door

"I am for now sir but soon we will all be dead so it doesn't matter" James replied despondently

"Not all of us will die" Baird encouraged

"What do you mean?" James asked with suspicion

Baird opened what James thought was just another section of wall that led into an escape tunnel "You can escape" Baird said quietly

"What about you sir?" James asked even though he already knew the answer

"Someone needs to stay behind to seal the hatch and hold them off Sergeant" Baird spoke indicating himself

"I hadn’t thought of that sir" James as he stared at the ground, suddenly he came to attention and snapped off a crisp salute "It was an honour to serve under you sir" he spoke, his voice tight as he moved to the hatch, he was in the tunnel when he heard Baird’s voice

"Oh and James" Baird spoke using James's first name "it was my honour to serve with you" once he finished he shut and locked the hatch. James shut his eyes and sighed as he knew he would not see Baird alive again.

James crawled to the end of the tunnel where there was a ladder that took him to the lower levels; as he mounted the ladder and stared at the hatch he heard a single gunshot, James shook his head and started down the ladder.

As James came to the last fifty or so rungs from the ground he decided to slide down; as he built up speed he began to hear noises down below, unable to stop James’s boots slammed into the ground as he spun bringing up his sidearm in his right hand and his light in his left, only to be met with a similar harsh light as his own. Just as James was about to order the unknown to lower their light a surprised gasp uttered from the other side of the light and it immediately snapped off."

"James is that really you?" An all too familiar voice whispered

"It sure is, Felicha" James confirmed as he snapped off his own light

Before James knew it Felicha ran up to him, buried her head in his chest, and began to sob. Her sobs were so gut wrenching that James found himself thinking back to the last time he had heard her sob like that, it had been years ago during the worst day of his life and the lowest point of his military career.
“Lieutenant Anderson you have been charged with: one count of inappropriate fraternization, two counts of dereliction of duty, one count of insubordination, and a count of assaulting a fellow serviceman” Captain Salen addressed, “Is that correct?” Salen asked as he was met with silence
“Yes Sir!” Anderson replied stiff and formal
“Do you wish to protest any of these charges?” Salen asked
Anderson hung his head in shame and mumbled out “No sir”
“Very well then, it is my decision that Lieutenant Anderson will suffer a reduction in rank from lieutenant to sergeant, will spend five days in the stockade and will be hereby ordered to stay at least 100 meters away from Private first class Felicha Mennen at all times” Anderson continued to hang his head in shame while Salen addressed Felicha “Mennen you are hereby ordered to stay at least 100 meters away from Sergeant Anderson at all times, that is all” Salen concluded as he snapped his portfolio shut and motioned for the Military Police.
Two of them stepped forward to escort Anderson to the stockade, as they gripped his arms he shrugged them off and moved to the door on his own effort, at the same time an MP was escorting Mennen to a side door Mennen’s eyes looked up just in time to meet Anderson’s pain wracked eyes. That was all it took for Mennen to break down into sobs, seconds later the door shut and mercifully cut off her sobs.
As James stood in the hallway of that god forsaken compound and comforted Felicha he made to wonderful discoveries; the first was that he had found his love again, and the second was that he rediscovered his certainty and self confidence, and with those he could survive anything including the horrors of hell itself.

"This is Sanderson any ATHER personnel receiving this go to freq tac two immediately"

Felicha looked up at James with her brow furrowed in confusion "Why tac two?" She questioned referring to the emergency secure channel ATHER personnel used only in times when contact was priority and all other forms of communication were compromised. James just shrugged his shoulders and flipped his channel toggle until it was on tac two, Sanderson's voice filled the airwaves

"Be advised I will repeat this message every thirty seconds until I receive a response or until-"

"Sanderson this is Anderson, are you receiving?" James interjected, Sanderson responded immediately

"Yes Sir I read you five by five" Sanderson replied with obvious relief in his voice

"Sanderson be advised that I have found PFC Mennen and we are returning to the surveillance room now" Anderson replied confidently

"That’s great sir but there is something I must tell you now" Sanderson stated in a flat voice

"What is it Sanderson?" James questioned "and why the switch to tac two" he pressed becoming alarmed

"Sir Walters and Rameriz are dead" Sanderson started

"What!" James exclaimed in hushed tones

"And government forces killed them" Sanderson finished just barely keeping the rage from his voice

James's blood ran cold when he heard the announcement, then it dawned on him why Sanderson switched to tac two "Do you think they are monitoring our communications Sanderson?" he whispered

"I don't know sir but I don't want to take any chances" Sanderson replied

"Acknowledged Sanderson we're on our way to you position now" James stated

"I'll be here sir, Sanderson out" Sanderson finished

James clicked off his radio and faced Felicha "Ready?" he asked

"Ready" she confirmed

James took point and together they moved down the hall
1111121211112111111111111112111111111112.title: Regrouping

1111121211112111111111111112111111111112.content:
James and Felicha crept down the hall together weapons at the ready, as they walked down the hall James saw a light flash at the end of the hallway. Before he could react a flashbang grenade rolled down the hallway and came to a rest at his boot, James knew he had seconds so he acted quickly: in the first second he kicked the grenade as hard as he could away from the two of them, second and third seconds he launched himself at Felicha tackling her out of the way, and at second four he yelled "GRENADE!", at second five the grenade exploded.

A ringing sensation filled James's ears, but thanks to his quick thinking he and Felicha both retained their eyesight. James pressed his back up hard against the pillar and peeked out, a bullet hitting the pillar not ten inches away from his head caused him to pull his head back in lest he lose it. Then out of nowhere an electronically filtered voice issued "Seargent Anderson, and Private First Class Felicha Mennen come out with your hands on your heads, and your weapons on the ground.

James responded in kind "not gonna happen fri-" but was cut off short as the muzzle of a rifle was jammed up against the base of his neck,

"I'd do as he said" another electronic voice commanded from behind them

Just as James and Felicha were about to lay down their weapons a familiar voice came from in front "I wouldn't" Todd Sanderson quipped with a grin. Thus reassured James and Felicha retrained their weapons on the figure behind them as Sanderson held the one in front of them hostage.

"Now then" James started "answer me this, just who the hell are you, and what the hell do you want?"

The figure remained silent for a minute then spoke up "My name is Snegurockha and all I want is for me and my operative to make it out of here alive"
1111121211112111111111111112111111111112.title: Continue

1111121211112111111111111112111111111112.content:
Just as James was about to speak Sanderson snapped his fingers "I knew you looked a little too suspicious" Sanderson said indicating the black clad warrior, "The armour, the code name, you're USOWB aren't you?"

"How do you know that?" Snegurockha spoke, deathly quiet

"Oh just from intercepting comm chatter up in the surveillance room" he remarked, when next he spoke he addressed James "Would you like to know something interesting Sergeant?"

"Don't I always" James replied drily

"The USOWB is the organization responsible for the deaths of every single ATHER operative except for the three of us" Todd stated grimly

"You mean the three of us are the last ones left?" Felicha asked horrified

"I'm afraid so" Todd answered

"Oh my god" James stated

"May I speak?" Snegurockha asked

James gestured with his sidearm "Go ahead"

“You must understand that my partner and I had nothing to do with the destruction of ATHER” Snegurockha stated

Sanderson snorted as he leaned back against the wall but kept the other black clad titan covered with his rifle, “Sir” he said turning his head towards James “that’s so much bull-“but was cut off as the other USOWB operative chose to act on Sanderson’s moment of inattention;

Impossibly fast he closed the gap between Sanderson and himself in less than a second, not stopping there he snaked his hand underneath Sanderson’s guard and wrapped his arm around Sanderson’s rifle, pulling up hard he sent the rifle flying from Sanderson’s grasp and into his own while simultaneously clocking Sanderson in the jaw with a jab from his armoured elbow.

As Sanderson flew backwards the operative snatched his sidearm from his holster and pointed it at him, while swinging his rifle into a position where he could cover James and Felicha, a second later Sanderson hit the ground with a thud.

The attack had happened so fast that neither James nor Felicha even had their weapons in firing position, James having both his rifle and sidearm pointed at the ground and Felicha having her pistol in its holster.

By the time James looked back to Snegurockha she had also retrieved her weapon and was now aiming it at him.
“Ok” James said breaking the tense silence that followed “this could be a bit of a problem”
1111121211112111111111111112111111111112.title: Turning the Tables

1111121211112111111111111112111111111112.content:
“I can see now that trying to reason with you was pointless” Snegurockha stated as her finger tightened on the trigger, but before she squeezed it James heard shouts coming from a nearby corridor. Upon hearing the shouts Snegurockha immediately faded into the shadows of the room, the other operative gave a glance at Sanderson who was propped up on his elbows glaring murderously at him and tossed him an informal salute before he too faded into the shadows as well.

The shouting began to grow louder and the three of them began to hear the thud of combat boots, the three of them looked at each other before scrambling for the nearest available place to hide.
1111121211112111111111111112111111111112.title: Out of the frying pan...

1111121211112111111111111112111111111112.content:
Just as the three ATHERS scrambled into good hiding spots a squad of five army soldiers burst in, rifles up and scanning as they proceeded to sweep the room. As James got a closer look at the soldiers he noticed that they weren’t equipped with standard issue gear they all had Land Warrior net rigs,

“Now why in the hell would these guys be equipped with Land Warrior” James muttered under his breath. After another five minutes all of the soldiers fell back to cover their squad leader as he sent his report,

“This is Charlie six actual, repeat this is Charlie six actual to command over” the squad leader spoke into a headset so James could only hear his side of the conversation, “Negative Sir the targets were not in the vicinity, Yes sir my men swept the area thoroughly, Sir I think our Intel might be stale, No sir I don’t think the heartbeat tracked is needed, I think they’re already long gone sir, Roger that sir Charlie six will comply, out”

The squad leader made a few sharp hand signals and the squad fanned out in the direction of the surveillance room. When the soldiers were gone James, Todd and Felicha broke cover and met in the center of the room, James spoke first

“Any Idea why they were wearing the net rigs?” he asked

“I think it might have to do with the fact that they are conducting a search” Todd answered

“But who are they searching for?” Felicha questioned

“Based on a conversation between two soldiers I overheard I’d have to say that they were hunting for none other than our USOWB buddies” Sanderson answered “and from what else I heard that way will take us to the elevator that goes to the surface” he said pointing at the hallway through which the soldiers entered.

“Well then what are we waiting for then?” James questioned, when silence met his question James shrugged and took point through the door while Sanderson stayed in the middle and Felicha brought up the rear as they stepped through the door they saw the freight elevator that was their salvation. “There it is!” James whispered excitedly, as they got closer to the elevator they saw the bodies. There must have been an entire platoon worth of them there, James knelt down to examine one of them and saw that his chest had been savaged by what looked like .50 caliber slugs.

“What the fuck is going on here?” Sanderson questioned as he stood guard with an M4 taken off of one of the dead soldiers.

“I don’t know Sanderson” James admitted “but I think we’ll find out soon enough, now come on let’s get on that elevator” he ordered as he stepped on the elevator.

“Yes Sir” Sanderson replied as he stepped onto the elevator as well. Felicha was the last to step onto the elevator as she turned and had one last look at the place that was literally hell on earth before stepping onto the elevator as well.

Sanderson slapped the elevator’s control switch, the grate slammed shut and it began to rise up out of the depths of hell, at the sudden rising motion; Sanderson let out a huge sigh of relief before slumping against the wall and raking his fingers through his sweat drenched hair and laughing, Felicha leaned into James’s embrace and quietly laughed, James smiled as he realized that despite the horror of hell itself he and Felicha still loved each other and with that realization he too started to laugh. Not because something was funny but because he now had a reason to live, Felicha.
1111121211112111111111111112111111111112.title: ...And onto salvation

choices: Stay with James and the group as they make their escape
Go to Major Harkin as he is betrayed
1111121211112111111111111112111111111112.content:
As James rested his head against the wall of the elevator he felt many things; he felt the gentle upwards motion of the elevator through the soles of his boots, he felt the press of Felicha’s body against his, but mostly he felt an overwhelming sense of relief that they were getting out of that hell hole alive. “But what to do after that” James thought, it instantly made him feel uneasy due to the fact that he hadn’t planned that far ahead, “well maybe it’s time I did” he thought again. “So Sanderson, Mennen, any ideas on what to do once we get out of here?” James asked

“My vote is that we catch the first flight to Hawaii and live out the rest of our days lying on the beach, drinking insane amounts of alcohol and admiring beautiful woman” Sanderson answered in a completely serious manner

James smiled at him “Seriously now Sanderson” he commanded

Sanderson sighed a sigh of mock defeat “If my brilliant master plan is to be rejected then I guess I will have to go with plan B”

“And that would be?” James asked managing to keep a straight face

“That we break into ATHER headquarters, erase or falsify our records so that they think we are dead, and live out the rest of our lives in hiding” Sanderson answered

“Christ Sanderson I said serious not suicidal!” James exclaimed as his eyebrows shot up in surprise

“And I don’t know if I’m comfortable with the idea of running and hiding when we should be trying to clear our names” Felicha added

“Don’t you get it Mennen, the government is out to kill us because we know too much not because we did something wrong!” Sanderson snapped; Felicha rocked back on her heels, shocked at Sanderson’s outburst, Sanderson himself quickly recovered and apologized “I’m sorry Mennen I guess the stress of everything just got to me”

“It’s okay Sanderson I understand your stress believe me, and if we’re going to go ahead with this plan of yours to drop off the grid you might as well call me Felicha” She stated

“Then you likewise can call me Todd” he affirmed to her

“Wait you’re on board with this plan too Felicha?” James asked even though he knew there was no other alternative

“Well if what Todd says is true then the government will never stop hunting for us, we might as well make it next to impossible for them to find us and live out the rest of our lives in peace” Felicha answered James’s mock scepticism

“I know, I know” James admitted as he held his hands out in front of him as a placatory gesture, “Well in that case then you can call me James” he smiled as the rays of the setting sun filtered through the mesh grate that was the elevator’s roof
1111121211112111111111111112111111111112.title: Planning on an uncertain future

choices: Go to James as he leads his group to safety
1111121211112111111111111112111111111112.content:
Harkin was sitting in his office doing some paperwork when two army soldiers walked in; their rifles in their hands, Harkin got to his feet and the soldiers immediately trained their rifles on him “Is there a problem soldier?” Harkin questioned, addressing the senior of the two.

“Sir I’m going to have to insist you come with us immediately, you’re under arrest” the soldier stated

“On what charge?” Harkin demanded

“Treason Sir” the soldier responded “Sir it really would be better for your sake if you comply”

“Very well then” Harkin responded calmly as he started to move, however on the inside he was seething with rage “How could they do this to me?” he raged “after everything I’ve sacrificed!” As he drew level with the soldiers he snapped a side kick which caught the senior soldier square in the solar plexus causing him to drop to the ground wheezing for breath, as Harkin recovered from his side kick he smashed his elbow into the Junior soldier’s jaw causing him to crash into the far wall, Harkin then turned his attention back to the senior and gave him a vicious kick to the ribs followed by a boot to the face, as he turned to face the Junior he saw him go for his sidearm, Harkin moved in and disarmed the soldier following that he smashed him in the face effectively knocking him out.

Harkin turned and surveyed the scene; working as fast as he could he moved to his desk and grabbed his silenced handgun, walked over to the two unconscious troopers and calmly shot each in the head, then he moved back to the plasma monitor and started up a video call with President Bowers.

After thirty seconds Bowers’ face materialized on the screen “Major Harkin what a surprise” Bowers stated

“Yeah I’m sure it’s not a pleasant one you son of a bitch!” Harkin snarled

“You are way out of line Major!” Bowers snapped

“Yeah and what do call sending soldiers out to detain me asshole!” Harkin replied hotly

Bowers face took on a more grim tone at this news “I’m sorry Major but operational security and whatnot, and after all it had to be clean very clean” he replied stressing the last point.

Suddenly it clicked in Harkin’s mind about what Bowers had said during the previous video call, about things needing to be clean “You son of a bitch, you planned this all from the beginning” he breathed

“Very astute Major, you finally figured it out” Bowers replied with nothing but pity in his voice “a shame that you won’t be able to put it to use”

As Bowers said this Harkin heard the pounding of combat boots approaching his position; Harkin looked back up at the monitor and shot it three times with his silenced handgun, next he moved to the far end of the room where he remembered seeing a liquor cabinet, Harkin flung open the doors and was met with a dozen or so bottles of various alcohol, he proceeded to pour the alcohol all over the room, with the thudding getting closer he poured one more bottle onto the floor, then took out his lighter, lit it, and threw it on the floor, as the building started to go up in flames Harkin jumped out of his window and into the night.

Once outside Harkin focused on putting as much distance between himself and the building as he could without being spotted however his efforts were in vain, for as he was turning a corner he came face to face with a soldier, the soldier started to bring his gun up and was about to issue a command when his neck suddenly snapped and he fell to the ground, dead before he hit it.

As Harkin stood in disbelief the familiar form of USOWB power armour came into view, as the figure stepped into the light it was reviled to be none other than Sergeant Sillis of Alpha team. “Sillis how the hell did you get here?” Harkin blurted out

“With all due respect sir it might be wiser to bring that up at a later date, for now we need to escape” Sillis responded

“Agreed let’s find some transportation to our destination” Harkin ordered

“Sir what is our destination?” Sillis asked

“The only strong point we have left” Harkin replied “ATHER headquarters”
1111121211112111111111111112111111111112.title: Betrayal

1111121211112111111111111112111111111112.content:
James lowered the binoculars from his face and took one last look at the burning building before making his way back to the stack of crates where Felicha and Todd were waiting

“So what’s going on out there James” Todd questioned

“Some crazy fool torched a building” James answered with a grin “it’s attracted what must be every soldier on this base”

“What!” both Todd and Felicha exclaimed in hushed voices

“That means that our path to the helicopter is clear” James continued mentioning the ATHER helicopter that they had found close to the river, James had a suspicion that it was Captain Salen’s personnel chopper and he shuddered when he thought about what the USOWB could have done to him.

“Alright then” Todd started “let’s get the hell out of here”

The three of them moved towards the chopper as quickly and silently as they could, when they finally reached it James scrambled into the cockpit to start the pre flight checklist, Felicha sat in the co-pilot’s seat and did what she could, while Todd stayed in the troop bay and covered them.

About two thirds of the way through the checklist James heard a muffled “Over there!” and then Todd shout

“We have company!” James immediately picked up his pace and hollered

“Just get me five more minutes!” As James looked back out the cockpit window he saw who the attackers were, they were those USOWB titans. “This could be a bit of a problem” James remarked seconds before they opened up.

As their rifles boomed James ran through the rest of the pre-flight, when James finished he turned in his seat “Come on Todd” he yelled struggling to be heard over the booming of rifles “it’s time to get the hell out of here!”

“I hear that” Todd’s weary voice came through “it’s time to-“but Todd was cut off as his head exploded from a .50 calibre slug and his headless body flopped down on the deck.

“Todd!” Felicha screamed as James swivelled back to the pilot’s controls not having the time to grieve for Todd, James pulled up hard on the yoke and the chopper pulled up hard into early morning light.

The USOWB had so far not fired on the chopper, James assumed it was because they wanted to use it to get out of there themselves but now that they were leaving the commandos opened up, four fifty cal slugs hit in the space of ten seconds, they didn’t bring the chopper down but they did their damage.
1111121211112111111111111112111111111112.title: The Price of Freedom

1111121211112111111111111112111111111112.content:
As James accelerated away from the complex he felt more then he heard the impacts from the commandos’ rifles, the chopper bucked once and then settled into normal flight operation, James preformed a quick systems check and seeing nothing other than some minor battle damage he gave Felicha the controls while he went back into the troop bay.

In the troop bay he crouched beside Todd’s headless corpse for what seemed like an entity before he finally reached over and slipped his dog tags off of his neck and put them in an inside pocket, before he could do anything else the chopper lurched violently to the left before pitching forward and plummeting to the ground.

James staggered into the cockpit and found Felicha cursing as she tried to bring the chopper under control but to no avail. James took a glance at the altimeter which registered of less than 300 feet and falling, far too low for a parachute to help them.

James strapped himself into the pilot’s seat and pulled up on the yoke as hard as he could trying to bring the helicopter up from a deadly nose crash into a survivable belly skid, pulling with all his might James succeeded in bring the nose up, a second later the chopper crashed into the woods.

As the chopper careened through the woods branches and sticks smashed through the windows and obscured James’s view, dirt piled in through the gaps irritating his eyes and throat, and rocks kept smashing into the fuselage causing James to snap left and right in his restraints, just when James thought it couldn’t get any worse the branches cleared and showed the view of a tree rapidly growing in the shattered windscreen, before James could utter any sort of warning to Felicha the helicopter smashed into the tree and everything went black.
1111121211112111111111111112111111111112.title: The Crash

1111121211112111111111111112111111111112.content:
At first all James could hear was the drip of water but gradually all of his senses kicked in and he could perceive much more, he could still hear the drip of water but now he could see the destroyed state of the helicopter, he could feel the restraints of the pilot’s chair digging into his shoulders but most importantly he could smell the stench of fuel.

At the smell of fuel he squirmed in his chair until he could see Felicha, she looked unconscious and was pinned by the console. Acting fast James drew his knife and cut through the restraints and stood up, a wave of pain shot up his right leg but James suppressed the pain and moved towards Felicha, as he moved he noticed that some of the displays on the console were sparking causing James to work even faster as he did not want to be anywhere near the explosion that would be generated by a tank of Jet fuel and sparks.

As fast as he could James slashed Felicha’s restraints and carefully lifted up the damaged console long enough for him to roll her out from underneath it, once she was laid out on the floor James stowed his knife and picked her up in a fireman’s carry. Just as James started to haul ass out of there he heard the shouts of searchers responding to the crash scene.

Having no time to argue with what James was sure was a squad of soldiers he simply exited the chopper on the opposite side of the shouts and made his way down the steep hill that was just in front of the tree that the chopper had crashed into.

Once James made it to the bottom of the hill he did not stop, instead he kept moving trying to get as far away from the coming explosion, just as James heard a shout of surprise from the top of the hill a massive explosion ripped through the air as the helicopter exploded.

James took one look back at the flaming wreckage before moving o, not wanting to get caught by the approaching authorities or a forest fire, although James was pretty sure that a forest fire would not erupt seeing as how the sirens were so close they were deafening, James turned his head back to the woods and within five minutes had disappeared into the forest.
1111121211112111111111111112111111111112.title: Escape and Evasion

1111121211112111111111111112111111111112.content:
After walking for about five or six klicks, across two rivers, and a rockslide, all of which was done with Felicha on his back James decided that enough was enough and found a rock overhang to set Felicha down in. Once he had set her down he withdrew a survival blanket from his vest, and unfolded it the blanket in its folded state taking up no more space than a napkin, and draped it over Felicha. With Felicha taken care of he canvassed the area and came back with tinder, kindling, and a few logs, everything James needed to create a basic fire.

Once James got the fire going he sat back and withdrew a granola bar from his vest, as he ate he reflected for the first time in hours about everything that had happened; the beast with no eyes, the thing with the tentacles, Louis’s death, the loss of ECHO, the screamer, Colonel Barid, the USOWB, finding Felicha, the destruction of ATHER, and the death of Sanderson.

All of it seemed so surreal but yet it had happened, just then James saw Felicha start to stir and so he yanked himself out of the past and back to the present. “Hey Felicha” James spoke softly “how are you doing?” he asked

“Uhhh...what hit me?” Felicha groaned

“Umm let’s see” James started to rattle off “the console of the helicopter, the tree-“

“Ok, ok I get the picture” Felicha moaned as she sat up

“You probably shouldn’t move” James cautioned as he moved to keep her down but she merely snuggled up to him and said

“I know”

As Felicha buried her head in his chest James stared at the fire, as he watched it die he thought about stoking it but before he knew it he was fast asleep.
1111121211112111111111111112111111111112.title: Rest and Recollection

1111121211112111111111111112111111111112.content:
As the morning sun raised James’s eyes cracked open to slits, what he saw did not impress him, there were two army soldiers standing over him and Felicha with their rifles raised. James’s eyes were fully open now and he could see that the soldiers knew he was awake, one of them motioned with his rifle for James to stand but before James could do anything the farther of the two soldier’s chest exploded, from a silenced rifle shot.

As the second soldier turned his head to gape at his dead comrade James sprung from his position on the ground and tackled the soldier, not stopping with just tackling the soldier James got him in a chokehold and did not let go, the soldier in a last ditch attempt to save his life elbowed James in the kidney, James let out a grunt of pain and his grip on the soldier slackened, the soldier sized on the opportunity to get back on his feet and point his sidearm at James.

Before the soldier could pull the trigger the right side of the soldiers face splattered outwards showering James in his blood and grey matter, for a full ten seconds James was so shaken that he couldn’t move but gradually he managed to get back on his feet, as he looked to the hill where he guessed the shots came from a clump of woodland suddenly resolved itself into the shape of an upright man.

As James watched the clump of woodland move suddenly a laser appeared on James’s chest, from there it traveled from his chest to his shoulder where his concealed ATHER patch was, on a hunch and with slow deliberate movements James reached over to his unit patch and ripped off the Velcro cover.

Immediately after the laser hovered on the ATHER patch it shut off, James looked back to the hill in time to see the sniper throw him an informal salute as he began to make his way down the embankment. James quickly made his way over to Felicha and woke her up, by the time he had finished explaining what had happened the sniper was standing directly in front of them.

“Sorry about that” the sniper apologized indicating the blood and grey matter on James’s jacket

“Well it was either this or death” James replied

“True enough” the sniper agreed

“So what’s your name?” James questioned

“Name’s Sam Weber” Weber stated

“Well thanks for the save Weber” James replied extending his hand

“Not a problem” Weber responded shaking James’s hand “and you are?” he questioned

“Oh my mistake” James started “I’m James and this is Felicha” he answered

“Well if we’re going on first names then you can call me Sam” Sam replied with a grin

“Happy to” James responded with a smile of his own
1111121211112111111111111112111111111112.title: Old foes, new friend

1111121211112111111111111112111111111112.content:
“So what are you doing out here Sam?” James questioned

“Well before the purges I was assigned as sniper support for the topside forces, since the purges I’ve been trying to stay alive and make it to ATHER headquarters” Sam answered

“Why have you been trying to make it to ATHER headquarters?” James questioned

“I’m guessing for the same reason as you are” Sam started “to wipe my records from the mainframe so I can have a shot at living a normal life” he answered

“How did you kno-“James started

“It’s not that hard to figure out” Sam interrupted “you guys are both ATHER, you're still alive, and you’re both heading towards ATHER headquarters”

“Do you want to come with us?” James questioned

“Sure, three people are better then two right” Sam replied

“Yeah I guess” James started “oh before we get moving I’m going to going to go down to the river over there and clean myself off” he finished

“Fair enough” Sam commented

When James came back he was a bit damp but otherwise completely clean, finally once the three of them were set they moved out through the forest and towards ATHER headquarters.
1111121211112111111111111112111111111112.title: Getting back on track

1111121211112111111111111112111111111112.content:
Having finished the day long trek through the forest the three ATHER’S now crouched in the ditch of the road that led up to the base’s main entrance, it was a pretty impressive display of force they had arrayed at the entrance: two humvees each equipped with fifty calibre browning machine guns, a squad of five army troops, two guard towers equipped with spotlights, and a sniper in each tower.

“So I’ve got what might seem like an obvious question here” Felicha whispered as they surveyed the entrance

“What is it?” James inquired

“Why don’t we just go through the forest and cut our way through the fence?” Felicha asked

“The reason why we can’t go through the woods is because they’d be expecting us, there’s too many: patrols, dogs and traps, not to mention anything about navigational hazards, or lack of supplies” Sam answered

“Makes sense” James agreed

“Ok, ok” Felicha sighed as she put up her hands in mock defeat “I said it was an obvious question”

Both men turned their attention back to the entrance, as they sized it up the trickling of an idea came into James’s mind “Maybe Felicha wasn’t all wrong in her question” he spoke

“I wasn’t?” Felicha replied dubiously

“She wasn’t” Sam repeated sceptically

“No her idea of going into the woods was wrong but her idea of cutting through the fence was sound, after all they just took control of the base not too long ago so what sort of security could they put on the fence besides guards” James answered

“They might not have had time to secure it properly but they did electrify it” Sam countered. Not to be daunted James shot back

“How can you possibly know that?” James demanded

“Because I saw one of the guards piss on it” Sam answered with a big grin on his face. James familiar with the basic laws of convection began to snicker as well.

“What’s so funny?” Felicha asked

“Well you see” Sam answered, James being indisposed “when you put electricity and water together the water convects the electricity, now imagine all the salts and what not and-“

“I get it now” Felicha cut him off not wanting to hear more, “real mature guys” she chastised

“As immature as I may be my point still stands,” Sam reminded her “which brings us back to square one, how do we get in?” Sam asked

Just as Sam finished his sentence James looked up as a realization dawned on him “Hey guys, why hasn’t the self destruct in the compound gone off yet?” he asked, both Felicha and Sam looked at James like he was nuts

“Why would that be a good thing James?” Felicha demanded

“Well it would be one hell of a distraction for one thing” James responded “and for another the resulting electromagnetic pulse would be a welcome advantage” he finished. What James did not know was at that very moment the survivors of the USOWB Bravo team were desperately trying to hold off the demons and rearm the self destruct in the compound, right as he finished his sentence they succeeded and five seconds after he said advantage the compound exploded.
1111121211112111111111111112111111111112.title: Discussions

choices: He does not get a response
11111212111122.content:
James looked at the stairs and realized that he was simply too exhausted to climb them so he trudged back down through the drainage pipes until he made it back to the door where he was sure Felicha was.

When he reached the door he noted much to his dismay that the door's control panel was dented and smashed and the door didn't look in the greatest shape which meant that it would be all but impossible to move by conventional means save one; explosives.

First things first though he had to establish that there was someone on the other side of the hatch so that he would not be wasting his explosives on an empty room. James strode up to the hatch and pounded on it three times as hard as he could, then ignoring the throbbing pain in his hand he stepped closer to the hatch and pressed his ear up against the cold steel and waited.
11111212111122.title: Continue walking

1111122.content:
Jaes pulled the watch back around the corner and sliped it on his wrist agian. 11111222.title: it notices him

111112222.content:
James's legs started pumping and the sheer adrenaline rush put James on autopilot. As his head spun back towards where that thing was all he saw was a mass of tentacles so he did what he had been trained to do, he reacted.

James ducked as the withering mass of tentacles shot overhead and then executed the fastest bug out of his career as he sprinted back up the hall.

James staggered but quickly regained his footing, as he continued his mad dash the thing began to catch up to the weakening James.

James called upon his last reserves of strength to round the next corner, as he did he noticed housings for what must have been a heavy blast door. James dove through the opening stabbing at the door controls with the thing hot on his tail.

Slammed down so hard that it knocked James on his ass, as he stood he wiped the sweat from his brow and ran his hands through his sweat slicked hair starting to grin in spite of his current situation. As James took a step he started to feel shaky in his legs and braced himself back against the wall.

"Well it’s no damn wonder" James scoffed at himself impressed that he had even made it this far as he slid down against the wall and for the first time since he got to the compound reflected on how he had gotten to where he was right then and there.

"Yes Lou what is it" Corporal Louis Richmond was James second in command as well as his best friend "Well sir I was just curious what did you mean by at least seven levels"

"This surveillance data was collected by SAT recon so it has its limitations" James sighed with disgust as the assorted ECHO team members let out moans and curses.

"I see sir" Louis replied as his voice hardened "Can Intel at least tell us enemy numbers and strength"

"Afraid not Intel has no solid recon in that department so just hope for the best-"

"-and plan for the worst" Louis finished "why does that not exactly fill me with confidence"
1111122221.title: Slammed down

11111222211.content:
"fucking Lou" James whispered under his breath.

James pushed the memory of Louis out of his mind, and focused on the current situation. Suddenly something smashed against the door hard enough to give the metal a groan and to throw James away for a few feet. Visibly shaken he climbed to his feet, staring at the darkened sillouette of the door. He flicked on his flashlight attachment at the end of the CAR and searched around the space, looking for something to stand on. He spotted a small wooden crate in one corner and grabbed it. James pulled himself up slowly and peered through into the corridor, it was eerily quiet out there and that made James uneasy. He squinted through the haze of red light and saw nothing, just empty corridor.

"Where the fuck did that thing get off to?" he said.

James took a deep breath, he climbed down shakily off the crate. His muscles were burning something fierce. James kept himself in relatively good shape, but the stress of the past hours had really taken its toll on him.

"Get it together sarge" he growled.

James looked around the room, he suddenly felt like a trapped rat. The room was small, and more importantly the room was empty except for the crate and a lonely crowbar leaning in the corner. James scanned the floor and landed on a drain cover, that drain cover made his stomach lurch. No doors, no other way out. James thought about it for a second before deciding to...

111112222111.content:
James finally decided to head down through the drains, with any luck they should emerge somewhere in the sewage nexus room and from there it would be a straight shot to the main surveillance room where he could check all of the CCTV cameras in the compound for any ATHER members that survived the front gate. James mind began to swirl as he remembered the front gate.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
"Come on soldier shift it!" Sergeant Anderson hissed as he watched the last of his ten operative team settle into position, he brought his wrist mounted PDA up to face and pressed the back light button. As the display shone a grainy green Anderson concentrated on the last few dots settling into position.

"Come on INDIA move it up double time" the Sergeant whispered into the boom mike attached to his radio "FOXTROT get your asses in gear"

As the acknowledgments came flooding in Anderson resumed his focus on the compound's front gate, As overall ATHER field commander Sergeant Anderson had a hand in formulating the battle plan that they were setting up for now.

The plan called for team FOXTROT to take out the watchtower guards from long range as half of their operatives were snipers, once FOXTROT had taken out the tower guards teams INDIA and ECHO would blow open the gate with preplaced charges storm the two security posts on the top as well as the admin and elevator to the lower levels. Once stage one was complete then the remaining teams behind them would use the elevator to get into the main complex while the teams above ground would provide comm. updates, vital supplies, extra manpower, and a secure base of operations.

It was a risky plan but hopefully the attack would be so fast and decisive that the defenders would never know what hit them. Finally the status reports of the fourteen teams under his command started to flow in

"Team ALPHA reporting in Sir"

"Team GAMMA reporting in Sir"

"Team SIERRA reporting in Sir"

It took a couple of minutes for the reports to finish up so Sergeant Anderson mused about the mission, the fact that the Cultist's compound was so big, underground and defended like a military base greatly disturbed Anderson. The other thing that disturbed him was the fact that Command had given him one hundred and forty operatives at his disposal, never before in his ten years of working with ATHER had he ever seen such a massive deployment of troops and equipment. Not that that mattered the Sergeant thought as he resolutely pushed the thoughts from his mind, he was a soldier his job was to carry out orders not to question them.

As the last of the acknowledgments came through he turned to Louis

"Team ECHO reporting in sir" Louis spoke with a tight wolfish smile on his face.

"Alright then" he muttered as he switched over to general frequency "All teams mission countdown: Ten, nine, eight, seven, six..."

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ------------------------------------------------------------------------------

"...Five, four, three, two, one" James thought to himself as he tensed then climbed down the now open manhole, crowbar in hand. As he reached the last few rungs on the ladder he simply let go, fell the last few feet and absorbed the shock of the impact with his knees.

As he stood he tried his GPS but all he got was a NO SIGNAL message

"Well there's a surprise" James muttered bitterly as he tried to get a fix on his position via dead reckoning. After a while James decided that it had to be to the right of the ladder, James had turned to leave and had gotten a few feet when he heard a deafening screech behind him.

James whipped around already bringing his CAR 15 up at what he assumed was a threat, when he did get turned around all he could see was darkness. James was about to dismiss it as nothing when he saw to pinpricks of light in the tunnel, then four, then six, then eight, and before he knew it there were dozens of pinpricks in the tunnel with James.

James was still puzzling over what to make of the lights when one of them disappeared and the reappeared, that’s when James realized with horror that they were not lights but eyes!
111112222111.title: Head down to the drains

1111122221111.content:
Without hesitation James threw the crowbar at the nearest set of eyes as hard as he could and was rewarded with a sharp crunch and a squeal of pain. James not waiting around long enough to find out if the crowbar did any damage took off sprinting into the drains to get as far away from those things as fast as possible.

As he once again made a mad dash to safety as his body went to autopilot his mind began to flash back to the gate battle

"Go, go, go!" Sergeant Anderson screamed into his boom mike "all teams move it!"

Before Anderson could even start moving to lead the charge Louis was shouting commands to the troops

"Come on, shift your asses now!" Louis bellowed as the ECHO members began to push off the wall they had been waiting on at the left side of the gate.

The SIERRA members began pushing off of the right, running to the gate and stacking up for a door breach. While this was happening FOXTROT'S snipers were shredding the tower guards with their .50 caliber sniper rifles.

Amidst the chaos Anderson made rapid fire hand signals to SIERRA'S team Sergeant, Duburt was his name. In turn Duburt made hand signals to his explosives expert or Spec Three who ran to the center of the gate with ECHO'S Spec Three and began to place breach charges.

Once they were done they both ran to their respective teams and gave their team leaders the thumbs up. Anderson and Duburt both looked at each other and nodded, they then turned to their Spec Three's who pushed their detonators.

As James shook off the memory he noticed that he was coming up to another ladder and just leapt the last few meters onto the ladder, as he started to climb he heard the creatures behind him so he spun around, on hand hanging on to the ladder the other gripping his .45.

He pulled the trigger three times and saw three pairs of eyes disappear into the darkness; he reholstered his pistol and bounded up the last few rungs. When he finally did make it to the cover he just popped it open with his shoulder scrambled through and slid it shut again, sliding to a nearby wall his CAR trained on the manhole cover as he heard little thuds of the things trapped under their tried to get out.
1111122221111.title: Many smaller creatures

11111222211111.content:
James was panting like a sick dog as he backed himself into a corner, his heart rate elevated and his eyes darting around. He continued to aim his CAR at the manhole cover until the last of the thuds died off.

James had his CAR in a death grip aimed square at the manhole cover when suddenly a shadow fell over him. James looked up right up into the face of the creature he encountered in the hall way with no eyes.

James whipped his CAR up only to have it swatted aside by the beast, it then proceeded to pick James up by the throat and bring his face up to James's. James could see: the empty sockets, the blood matted fur, the flesh hanging from its jaw, and the jagged stump where its arm used to be. He could smell the: rot, decay, sweat, and somehow he could smell the evil; it grated on the back of his sinus like the stench of burnt popcorn.

James threw up all over the creature's face due to both the smell, sight and fear of the creature. The creature didn't seem to be affected instead it merely pulled James closer to its hideous face, sneered and spoke in a voice that filled James with true fear

"What you seek is a testament to all your sins"

James stared back at the creature, a mixture of fear and misunderstanding welling up inside of him. He continued to stare at the creature until it suddenly and viciously hurled him into the wall that he was sitting at before.

Strangely he felt no pain as he smashed into the wall, suddenly his eyes popped open and there was nothing in front of him just empty space. James began to scream, he screamed until his voice went horse. Once he managed to stop screaming and come to his senses he realized that his ass was asleep and the only way it could get to sleep like that was if he sat in one place for a long time.

"But wait" James whispered to himself "Wasn't it only a few moments that I was here"

Creeped out by the dream and his apparent loss of time he jumped out of his spot and headed for the door.
11111222211111.title: Continue

111112222111111.content:
James pushed his way through the door only to find that beyond it lay a cramped maintenance hallway, full of hissing pipes and thick dank air. "Well nobody ever said that this was going to be easy" James spoke, taking refuge in the sound of his own voice as he started down the passageway. As he came to a T intersection he noticed a complete lack of noise "The calm before the storm" James thought grimly to himself as he raised his CAR, seconds later the creatures attacked.

They looked vaugely human however their eyesockets were empty black pits their eyes having been burned out by the extreme red light that seemed to emanate from within them, their guts were split open as well revealing intestines that through some sort of dark transformation had now become barbed whiplike tentacles almost.

At first it wasn't so bad they would round a corner and the CAR would take their head clean off, but soon they were flooding around both corners at the same time, James fell back knowing that he could not hold his position. Just as James was about to make a fighting retreat his bolt clacked open, James checked his vest and swore in frustration seeing that he had no more magazines, James ditched his rifle and started to make a mad dash out of there with those things hot on his heels.

James zigged and zagged he turned left and right but nothing he did could shake those things, finally as he rounded the bend he saw his salvation a vent that was built into the wall but right on the floor. Not stopping to aim James whipped out his .45 sidearm and emptied half a mag into the grate which flew open in a few flashes and sparks, as James dove in he noticed that the vent was large enough to fit him and allow him to turn around. Just as he was about to start his mad crawl towards freedom he came up short as he felt a hand lock onto his ankle with an iron grip, not having time to argue he once again pulled out his trusty .45 and emptied the other half of his mag into the creature. Not having time to admire his handiwork and caring only about the fact that the grip on his ankle disappeared he turned back around and began to madly crawl down the vent, however after about two minutes of crawling James hit a section of vent that was weaker and collapsed under his weight. As James hit the floor he lost consciousness and was engulfed in darkness.

The way James saw it he had two options...

He peeked through the slot that he made and observed if there is someone in the lighted room. He knew too well that barging in not wise, especially if he is not familiar with the area.

There wasn't anyone though. He pushed the door wide open and entered the room. The room is filled with nothing but machines, all turned on. The lights on the machines kept flickering.

James hears a far away sobbing. He didn't know who it was, but it sounded a cry of a child. He wondered the chances of a child staying in the vicinity -- it was very slim. He followed the sound, his feet leading him to the next room of where he is. He approached the door he saw, leaned against it to make sure that he wasn't hallucinating; upon confirming that what he is hearing is really present, he slowly opened the door, his defenses up.

James slowly approached the child letting his guard down. He had a one-track mind seeing the child, <I>"what can a child do"</I>, though he got surprised by the child as it turns out the child is somewhat like an undead zombie-like.

The child with a rotting face, too indescribable to words as if it had been scraped by something, torn clothes, nails broken leaped onto James. It attacked James fiercely and didn't give a chance for the man to retaliate.

James did as he could to defend himself as the child kept attacking him. He is too close to the child to fire a shot; his hands were already busy enough to holding the child from preventing himself being wounded.

James and the child wrestled on the floor. The machines got kicked, things became messy as the stuff got scattered while the two wrestled on the floor.

James struggled for dear life with the undead child on floor and debree, its supernaturally strong teeth taking bites at his arms with which he tried to hold it at bay. Finally it successfully took a bite from James's arm, but as fortune would have it, it bit his watch, which stopped the child's teeth from penetrating his flesh.

Trying desperately to let the undead child let go, he failed to notice the slomping footsteps of another fullgrown adult zombie appearing from the other side of the room. Only when the heard the moaning, did he look around to see his doom.

The child kicked the gun out of James hands and smiled wickedly as it prepared to finish him off... only it didn't. It stayed frozen in place for a few moments before its eyes flashed with a blinding light that caused James to instintively cover his own eyes to protect them. When the brightness returned to normal he found himself sitting alone onthe cold floor with his gun laying nearby. He wiped the sweat from his brow and left the room wondering why the monster child had left. "It had me at its mercy... and let me go... no, it willingly retreated for some reason, but why...?" There were also a few open doors and more then a little blood splattered across the walls, but otherwise there was nothing out of the ordinary.
