"Shit, it looks even worse down here then the last level... I'd better get moving..." With new resolve James began confidently moving down the hallway, only to stop when he heard someone scream. It sounded like a young woman... but James had no way of knowing where she was...
124.title: Going down...

125.content:
"I'm not going back!" with a high raspy voice, the boy screamed, fighting James. "Not again! Not again! Not again!"

"Easy now!" barely handling the hysterical child, James shouted. "I'm Sergeant James Anderson, leader of ECHO team!"

Slowly, uncertainly, the boy stopped struggling and looked at James with tears flowing from his deep, socket like eyes. "You- You are not The Others?" trembling, he asked. "You are- are not here to- to drag me back?"

"I am here to stop the monsters who made this place." breathing heavily, James said. "Who are the others?"

"S-Scary people." crying the boy said. "They came from the big doors. Men with horns, walking bones...."

James tilted his head slightly, asking, "The big doors?"

The boy nodded. "Down there, behind the statue the cloaked people prayed to." pointing down, the boy said. "The doors opened and they came out, dragging everyone in." he buried his rotted face into his putrid colored hands, sobbing as he added, "I- I got away but- but it hurt... it hurt, it hurt, it hurt...."

James sighed, watching the small, traumatized child rocking himself back and forth, sobbing. "I can't imagine the hell you must have gone through." softly, he said. "Stay with me and I will keep you safe."

Trembling, the boy turned to James with a tiny glimmer of hope in his eyes. "You- You promise?" looking at James, he asked. "You w-will keep me sa-safe?"

Ignoring the foul smell of the child, James pulled him into a warm hug. "I promise."

The boy cried onto James' shoulder as he gently picked him up. "Do you have a name?" looking around, he asked.

"Cory." his crying subsiding, the boy said. "Cory Jones."

"Well, Cory Jones, I need to find out if there are any other survivors in here." quietly, James said. "Do you think you can help me with that?"

Cory nodded. "I-I'll try."

What does James do next?
125.title: The Others

choices: You nuts? James isn't a douchbag. He refuses to give up Colin.
1252.content:
James picked up the petite rotted form of Cory and held the undead child under and against against his side. "Come. We can't stay here. Hold tight."

James regretted his instruction since Cory, not knowing the supernatural strength of his zombified arms, squeezed the breath from his ribs, making him grunt in pain. Cory realized his mistake and immediately relented: "Sor-ry. I'm sorry. I didn't mean it!"

James chuckled: "Never mind. I've had worse. Now, keep open your eyes and ears for other survivors."
"Okay." said Cory softly.

They hadn't progressed 10 paces, when they heard what they were searching for.

A thunderous clanking of pipes on metal resounded through the hall, followed by vehement swearing.
"Shit! Outch! Sonofabitch! Hell's fucking bells! Nearly broke my bloody foot on that junk!" came a gruff voice.

"Oh for pity's sake, Lenggries. Will you stop swearing so needlessly? Its barbaric." said a woman.
"Oh I'm sorry, Petrova. Your absolutely right." said the first low voice sarcastically. "Seeing our comrades turned to gore and hellspawn roaming the earth is no cause for not behaving properly in public. Next time I'll act like a gentleman while we try to survive this sh-"

"Your such and ass! Neanderthals have more finesse." retorted the woman.
"Yeah. Least I know how to get-"

"'Shut up, both of you!" came a third voice which held athourity. "Stay focused and keep quiet. You'll bring every imp and demon in a hundred meter radius down on us if you continue to make this racket. Our mission is far too vital for screw-ups. The Gate is a mere half kilometer away to the North. Also, be warned, I sense 2 supernatural entities in the room to our right. Prepare yourselves."

"Fine, I'll take point." said the gruff voice.

James eyed the entrance to the hall nervously and his hand moved to his pistol holster. Colin clutched him, terrified.

3 figures emerged in the bright light of the doorway. They were clearly human, but that was about the only reassuring attribute about them. They were all clad in black leather; all looked unfriendly and intimidating.

The blond, bearded giant in front was the most fearsome. He had a disforming scar running the length of the left side of his face. An eyepatch shielded the left eye. Most notable about the gargantuan man, was that his entire right lower-arm had been converted into a compact 3-barreled minigun; the ammunition belt that fed it, snaked across his right shoulder and appeared to emerge from the metallic backpack the large man wore. He looked the absolute wrong bloke to screw with.

The 2 individuals flanking his sides, didn't appear any less menacing. A woman stood on the giant's right. Her short black hair in a spiky buzz-cut; she had gruesome tattoo's of bats, dragons and scorpions covering her open arms and shoulders. She carried a katana in one hand and a sub-machine gun in the other.
The last man, standing on the blond giant's left, was perhaps the most frightening. He was an albino. He was clad completely, from neck down to his toes and fingers, in dark leather. He looked as if he wore the uniform of a colonel spray-painted black. An ink-black cap was pulled low over his red-pink eyes. His snow white hair and translucent skin was accented by the rest of his body being covered in such dark attire, making his face appear similar to that of a ghost. He held his arms crossed behind his back, like a bored officer inspecting his troops.

An evil grin spread across the blond giant's face as he saw James and Cory: "Oh look! More undead targets."
He raised his minigun right arm, his left going to the firing lever attached to its upper side...

"Wait, Lenggries." said the woman. "The man is still human! Don't kill him!"
"The thing he's holding sure isn't, Petrova."

"Who are you people?!" asked James, finding his voice at this trio of weirdo's. He presumed them mercenaries.

"Sir!" said the woman named Pretrova urgently at James. "Let go of that child, NOW! It's undead, It'll kill you!"

Colin looked at James pleadingly with his sunken eyes: "You promised you wouldn't leave me!!!"
"I won't." James unholstered his .45 colt and aimed it at the giant named Lenggries. "Why don't you put away the gun, friend?"

"Watch it pal, if you don't put away that little peashooter of yours, I'll shred you in half with led!" warned Lenggries darkly.

"I'll do the same once you lower YOUR firearm, friend." said James menacingly.

"Not while that scrap of wormfood in your hands remains in one piece, I will."

"I am not letting go of this kid."

"You either let go of the freak or I gun you both down."

James turned to his side, shielding the zombie todler with his body, from the minigun's line of fire.
"You just try and I'll slug your remaining eye." said the outraged James.

"Please sir." begged the woman, desperate to avoid a bloodbath. "That child is no longer human. You have to let it go!"

"Over my dead body." Colin looked up gratefully at James, who held him close.

"Your wish." said the giant callously.

James sweated profusely. A bloody shootout seemed inevitable.

"Enough!!!"

It was the albino. His sharp voice cut through the air like a knife through a cake. His voice held such a commanding tone, that none dared disobey him. "You will all stand down! Lower your weapons this instant!"
Both James and Lenggries complied.

The albino looked at the blond giant with disdain: "Lenggries, have you succumbed to the level of depravity of the hellspawn? You would kill your fellow man so easily?"
The giant spat back: "I was only bluffing! I just wanted that retard to let go of the undead. Our mission was supposed to ensure that no demon or infected was to escape to the surface, no matter the cost. Wasn't it? To exterminate all the hellspawn down here?"

"You." the albino indicated to James. "Please identify yourself." The way he said it, made it clear it wasn't a request.

"I am Sergeant James Anderson, leader of Echo team. I am part of ATHER, a counter-terrorist unit. I was sent here to stop a cultist terrorist group from-"
"Well your a bit late on that one." said the albino.
"What do you mean?"
"The cultists are all dead, least from what I could tell from the screams...and so is just about everything...humanoid...down here. Still, its refreshing to at least meet another survivor from ATHER in this literal hellhole. One that isn't undead, I mean."

"You're ATHER personal?" asked the surprised James.
"Indeed. We are Omega team...or rather its remainder. I'm Leutenant Blank. The charming fellow over there with the personality disorder is Corporal Lenggries-"
"Up yours." said the giant blond, flipping them off.
"-and the Lady is Corporal Petrova."

Petrova anxiously nodded her head in James's direction, as if to indicate something deathly important.
"Ah, Sergeant. Pardon for my rudeness, but...I strongly, STRONGLY advise you letting go of that child immediately. It is undead."
"I already told you, I am not letting go of the kid."
"I don't know what...personal attachments you have with him..." said the albino.
"IT! It's a bloody rotting corpse!" shouted Lenngries from the side.

The albino ignored him, and continued to talk persuasively to James. "But he's no longer alive. He has no emotion, no recollection. Very soon he will turn feral and most likely attack you. You will probably be bitten, and infected. And then we will be forced to kill you. For no infection may reach the surface. He is no longer human. Let him go now so we can mercy kill him, and let him rest in peace."

James looked down at the pitiful mass of the child he he held in his arm. Colin stared back, petrified. Blank's words sounded convincing. Colin certainly didn't appear to be alive. He stank of decaying meat. His skin looked grey and green in some places. His face was stretched tightly across his bony skull. James could even feel the wet mucus running down his side from the kid. Worst of all he felt cold and clammy. Just like a corpse. No heat emanated from Colin's tiny body. It was evident he was dead, if not undead.

And yet...Colin seemed genuinely scared. Tears ran down his face at the prospect of being given up by James. He looked very lifelike; not like a wild beast at all. No. James would never abandon a child in need, even at the risk of his own life. Even if that child was supposedly undead. And he had promised to keep Colin safe, hadn't he?

Now what?
1252.title: Return to the hall.

12523.content:
"I'm burned, torn to pieces, and sliced up but I'm not dead!" summoning some courage, Cory barked.

All three figures froze, looking stunned as they heard Cory's voice. "He's alive!" whispering, Blank said. "Perhaps just barely, but he's still alive!"

"The little shit won't live long if he was bitten." darkly, Lenggries said. "We're taking one hell of a chance..."

"Then don't follow me." sternly, James said. "My mission has not changed. I have to stop this, meaning closing the doors that were open by those suicidal cultists."

"Its a one way trip, Anderson." warning him, Petrova said. "You may not survive long enough to reach the gates, let alone seal them with the amount of hell-spawn that is certain to be coming through."

"If I do not try, the gates will remain open and your mission will be a futile point as all of Earth will be living in hell." with a deadly seriousness, James replied. "Now then, are we going to continue squabbling over Cory here or are we going to shut up and do our jobs?"

Lenggries turned red. "I don't take orders from you!" angrily, he barked.

Suddenly, Cory gasped. "They're coming!" terrified, he whispered. "From that room, I can feel them coming!" he pointed to the room the three came from. "Dead people are coming!"

Now hearing the low moans of zombies echoing in the room behind him, Lenggries turned and fired his mini-gun at the advancing figures. Only they kept coming. "Damn it!" angry, he screamed. "You have to rip them completely apart to kill these fucking things!"

"Their heads!" frantic, Cory yelled. "Hit their heads!"

Lenggries grunted and moved his aim at the zombies heads then grinned darkly as they fell like flies. "Die, bastards!" after loading another chain of ammunition, he yelled. "Back to hell with you!"

Once all was quiet again, Petrova ran back and pushed the door closed before sealing it. "If the kid had not, err, felt them coming, we would not have had a chance." glancing at Cory, she said. "Thanks, kid."

A small grin formed onto Cory's burned face. "I'm not dead yet."

Upon looking at Cory again, James saw that he was not decaying but burned, as he had said. Only his unnatural cold body made him worry. "He's not dead yet." he thought. "Let's hope it stays that way."

"You are welcome to join our team, the kid too." serious, Blank said. "Just bear in mind. The second he turns on us, I will kill him myself."

James nodded darkly, he knew Blank was not bluffing.
12523.title: Something else.

125231.content:
"Now, that being said. Let's get down to business. The mission at hand: the closing of the Hell-Gate." Blank said this as if he was done discussing a particularly boring subject and had more pressing concerns on his table.

"Before we....met -" he indicated with his head to James and the lithe form of Cory clinging to his side. "- Me and the rest of Omega-team were heading out to the Security-Console in room 34B. It houses the Camera room." Blank pointed to the flickering lights above them. "If would appear there is still electricity in this facility, which means the computers and mechanized equipment may still be functioning down here. If we can find the central Security-Consoles, we may be able to view the video feed from the cameras all over this facility and get a clear idea of what just the hell happened. And that wasn't an intended pun." he added.

James smiled at the joke: "Do you know where this Camera-room is?"

"Yes." he dug a tiny device from his back-pocket and held it out to James. It looked nothing more than a wide-screen cellphone. "A PDA. Please keep this in your possession at all times. It functions as a walky-talky, a tracking device and holds a GPS along with the schematics and blueprints of this facility. Please use this to not get lost or to finish this mission if the rest of us all die." What a ray of sunshine you are Blank, thought James.

"Not that I'm not grateful." said James taking the PDA. "But you're rather quick to trust me."
"You are the first humanoid.....being besides myself and the survivors of Omega-team whom hasn't tried to taste my face in 4 hours.
That makes you a very trustworthy person. That and I'm obviously short of personnel. I rather need some...human allies at this moment." he indicated the 2 figures of Lenngries and Petrova whom were standing besides him silently and respectfully. James knew that each ATHER team consisted of 15 members, which meant they had taken some extremely heavy losses to have been reduced to just 3 people.

Blank nodded his head to James's side, his red-pink eyes hovering over Cory from beneath his black cap.
"I only ask that you keep ensuring that...the child remains...trustworthy as well." Blank seemed to have this thing for pausing before a word as if to overstate its intended euphemism.

But before James could answer, Blank interrupted and continued as if he had expected an angry retort.
"So. The plan of action is rather basic. We get our over to the Security-Console and camera room. There we will probably find recordings of the events that have taken place since the breech. Best never to go into deep action without being prepared. And even if we don't find any tapes, we may find live camera feed about this facility and be able to determine where precisely the Gate is. Also there is a microphone located there in which we might be able to communicate to any other remaining survivors. And even if we don't find any of the above-" Blank looked at his own personal PDA attached to his belt. "The Camera-room is North-North-East from here; we'll only be getting closer to the gate which is directly North from where we are currently standing. We'll figure out the rest as get there, assuming we don't all perish.
If you have any objections or any better ideas, please voice them Sergeant."
The way Blank said it, made it clear James should rather keep his mouth shut as he couldn't possibly think of anything more clever than mentioned by the albino.

"None. That sounds fine."

"Excellent. Now that were all good comrades-" in ironic contrast to this, Lenggries just scowled at both Cory and James, making it brutally obvious that he neither liked nor trusted them. Petrova at least seemed to have admiration for them both.
" -lets get moving. Petrova?"

"Sir, there's a back door here. I say it best to avoid the main hall."
"Of course. Please open it, Petrova." Petrova used her sharp slender katana as a crowbar and undid the locking mechanism of the wooden door with a single well-placed twist.

"Splendid." said the albino. "Let's not dawdle. We're already behind schedule. The less we remain idle, the less we attract.....undesirables." Yep, Blank had a thing for Euphemisms, thought James. "Lenggries, please take point."

"Kiss my ass! I'm not walking anywhere where I can't see the lump of wormfood right in front of me." said the blond, bearded cyclops gruffly, pointing to Cory.
"Stop calling me names!" retorted Cory. James suspected Lenggries was never an easy man to work with.

"Oh the delights of working with the immature." said Blank shaking his head in his black-gloved fingers. "Fine then. You take the rear-guard. Petrova will take the front-guard. I will cover our 9, James our 3. And Lenngries...don't let any undead kiss your ass."

"Whatever." But Lenngries complied, smiling crookedly. Blank was the only commander he had ever respected; he had a smart mouth on him at the very least.

"Let's get going. Let us show these hell-spawn that ATHER is not to be fucked with." James was surprised at hearing the neutral albino swear for the first time.
And so the party stepped through the wooden door and into the enveloping shadows and dangers that lay beyond...
125231.title: Now it really begins...

1252311.content:
"Do you sense any... dead people, kid?" asked Blank, eying Cory.

"Behind the doors." in a fearful whisper, Cory replied. "They hear us but they are afraid to come."

"The fuckers are dead!" unimpressed, Lenngries said. "What the hell do they have to fear?"

Suddenly Cory gasped. "Stop!" hoarsely, he whispered.

"Halt!" in a whisper, Blank ordered.

Everyone froze as Cory whispered, "The ceiling."

Blank and James looked up to see a strange creature, seemingly rooted into the ceiling with a a large round mouth at its top with several sharp teeth and good ten foot long tongue with barbs down its entire length. Looking up, around them, James saw that there were a good twenty or thirty of them. They were patiently waiting for their next meal to fall within their grasp.

"What are they?" stunned, James asked.

http://images2.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20...

"More hell-spawn." aiming her sidearm, Petrova said. "Only why are those brainless zombies weary of them?"

Her answer case as we all heard what sounded like a raspy laugh and turned to see one zombie had come from a door and was caught by one of the creatures. The poor creature struggled, almost as if it were still human while other tongues lashed out and grabbed onto the pray. To our horror, the zombie was torn asunder with its putrid blood being spilled all over the walls and floor before the tongues came down, liking the blood clean with ravenous vigor.

"Disgusting vermin!" spatting, Lenngries yelled. he raised his mini gun.

"No!" quietly, Cory warned.

Too late, the loud noise caused all the tongues to reach down before a creature, inside the first to lower to the ground. They gave out an unnatural high shrill then ran after the group.

http://2half-life1freeman.webs.com/Headc...

"Run!" panicked, Cory yelled. "Run for the far door!"

There was no time to think, we all ran for the far door as Lenngries fired at the ones that came too close. Once we were all through, James pushed the door closed and sealed it tight as the creatures hissed and shrieked in anger on the other side. "Too close!" breathing heavily, he said. "What were those things!?"

"They are called 'gate keepers'." lighting a cigarette, Blank said. "From what I understand from the briefing, they protect the gate from being reached." pausing, he added, "Apparently this cult got past them."

"Or they 'set up shop' after the gates were open." mussing, James said.

"Possible, we will have to keep our eyes open for them." nodding, Blank said.

"Um... Blank... sir..." stuttering, Cory said.

Blank turned and sighed as he found they were in....
1252311.title: Continue.

12523112.content:
"Ah, crap." said Lenggries, spitting on the ground. "Out of the frying pan and neck-deep into shit."

The scratching and screeching of the 'gate-keepers' on the other side of the metallic door was momentarily forgotten as the party saw around 20 sets of animalistic eyes glowing in their flashlights and the flickering head-laps on the ceiling. Low moaning, growling, weezing and sounds of air escaping through damaged larynxes came from the shadows.
Like amphibians emerging from dark-murky water, 2 dozen zombies emerged from the darkness.
Their pale-green rotting skin shone like sweat in the fluorescent light and maggots fell from their eye-sockets to be trampled by the hulking undead into squishy pulps...

There were none of those giant-tongue creatures hanging from the ceiling in this room and the walking-corpses seemed to have no trouble or fear concerned with these humans.
Suddenly in contrast to their previous clumsy, slow shuffling walk, this group of zombies broke into a sprint and charged with surprising and inhuman speed and agility at the helpless from of Blank, whom had entered this room first and stood isolated far from the rest of the group.

Sweating, James fumbled to get his CAR 15 unslung from his hips; he was stunned to see Petrova and Lenggries do nothing! They just stood contentedly, their weapons not even raised to save their commander from being overrun and mauled! James wanted to shout at them: what the hell was wrong with them, but their was no time...

Cory was sitting on James's back, having hitched a piggy-back ride and this prevented James from having being able to undo the CAR-15 from it sling; his hand went to his Colt .45, but it was too late: the undead swarm was upon Blank!!

Blank stepped forward and raised his right arm: a handgun seemingly had magically appeared in his hand; so fast and swift had he drawn it. It was a Glock 182 heavy-slug semi-automatic pistol. The glock series of handguns were notorious for having a deadly armor-piercing round and a rapid rate of fire, but they were mostly unpopular for their being extremely heavy as a sidearm. It was generally discouraged for weaker troops to wield them as they required both arms and a lot of stamina to even just hold them straight and stable for aiming. The fact that Blank held the Glock 182, stable, unwaivering and firm in just one arm clearly showed he had a great deal more strength than he let show in his skinny black-leather clad frame.

The first zombie came within range and tried to make a grab for Blank; it earned him a hole in the forehead which sent it reeling backwards. And before the stunned eyes of James, Blank proceeded to dispatch the remaining undead with cold, murderous and unequaled efficiency. Not a single zombie came even close to laying a hand on him with their weathered bony fingers as Blank slugged them all one-by-one.

Like an elegant fencing champion, Blank stood firm, held one hand on his left hip and used only his right for killing; cigaretet still lodged in lips at an angle. He was so brutally efficient, that he never wasted or missed a single shot. In fact: not more that a single round was fired per zombie. Each fell in turn as a bullet from Blank's Glock pierced their necks precisely, as if by auto-guided fire. Blank displayed some supernatural marksmanship.

As 18 corpses that would now remain corpses forever lay at Blank's feet, James now understood why Petrova and Lenggries had not intervened. They had been so confident at their commander's skill and competence, they hadn't even bothered to aid him.

In the following silence of gunfire, James noticed that the 'gate-keepers' had stopped laying siege to the metallic door the party had come in from, as there were no scratching or squealing from beyond anymore.

"Well that was impressive, Luitenant. I thought you were done-"

"Shut up and remain quiet, Sergeant!" Blank seemed on edge as he alternatedly pointed his sidearm to the roof, the floor and the walls in the visible part of this room. James was surprised to see Blank looking afraid, as even with the hell-spawn zombie swarm that had nearly overwelmed him, he had kept an icy cool.

"Child. Cory. You could sense all those undead and hell-spawn earlier. Can you sense something else in this room?" asked Blank.
"No-no sir. You killed all of them."

Blank had a twisted-cynical smile on his face, but he looked deathly pale, if that was even possible on his translucent white skin.
"Below us." he said, tensely. Petrova, Lenggries and James( now with his .45 Colt in hand) aimed their respective guns at the ground, but there was nothing but solid marble.
"What's wrong Sir?" asked Petrova like a concerned sister.

Her answer came in the form of a rumbling below and a high-pitched howling like an eagle being skinned alive. The sound of pipes on metal and flapping wings hitting obstruction followed from below.
"Quick." said Blank urgently. "Find any ventilators or air-ducts and cover them!!!" All complied, searching for any openings to the room, but there was none.

The rumbling an racket continued then stopped without warning. The silence once again hung like thick smog in the air. James could hear the blood pumping through both his ears as well as Petrova's standing a meter away from him. Cory's dead heart remained unmoving.
"What is it?!" he hissed at Blank.

Lenggries spat against a warning poster that stated spitting was prohibited in this room: "Well that was fucking anticlimactically undramatic-"

A girder in the corner on the floor of the room they had missed, shot into the ceiling with brick-breaking force followed by a hideous howling monstrosity. It had putrid yellow scaled skin and was humanoid in structure. But a pair of giant bat wings stretched from his back. Its hands and feet were webbed claws and its face was a gaping teethed maw with pitch-black orbs for eyes attached. It flapped in place menacingly.
"SHCYFER AARON BLANK! YOU WILL NOT LIVE TO SEE THE LIGHT OF DAWN!" It screamed in a scratchy ugly voice.

"Gabzagul. Been a long time. How many times have I killed you already? 6?" James was appalled by Blank's callous demeanor as he himself stared at this beast in petrified horror; Cory trembled on his back.

"YOU LAUGH AT YOUR OWN DEATH MORTAL! EVEN IF YOU REACH THE GATE, YOU WILL NOT EXIT IT!"
"I'm still not impressed. You're starting to run out of original threats old friend."

"I WILL FEED ON YOUR HEARTS!!!" the creature raged, filling the roam with fear.
"Then come get them!" cat-called Blank. "We're not handing them over in platters!"
The creature seemed to need no invitation as it half-charged/half-glided across the room in a frenzy as fast as it's legs and wings could carry it in a bee-line to Blank.

Leggries's concentrated barrage strafed its wake, but he stopped as he saw James and Petrova would be in his line of fire; the same scenario for them to Lenggries. That left Blank to fend for himself once more...

Like an agile matador avoiding a charging bull, Blank dodged the flying-beast in the last split-second by side-stepping and crouching. The creature turned, only to find the Glock 182 pointed into its open maw.
"That makes number 7." said Blank to the creature.

Unlike with the swarm of zombies earlier, Blank made no attempt to fire his weapon efficiently. Like a street-ganster he passionately emptied his magazine into the face of the roaring demon, who clutched its facial wounds from which vile black blood squirted like sprinkler flows. The demon collapsed and Blank stood over it, still firing his side-arm even after it stopped twitching.
He breathed heavily and sat down tiredly on the cold floor.
His comrades rushed to him.

"What was that thing?" James asked breathlessly to Blank who shook his sweating head and stood back up.
"Familliars. Not as deadly as Pit-lords. Still makes a mess to kill." he said this as if he was apologizing to his visiting guests for his pet having dirtied the living room.

"Cigarette." said Petrova simply. Blank took out his and saw that a tiny speck of the Falliar's black blood had found its way on the burning tip.
Blank sighed and threw the cigarette stump into the widening pool of blood that was oozing from the dead Famillar demon.
"Seems my private doctor is preventing my smoking from beyond the grave. Let that be a lesson for you Sergeant James. It's the corrupted blood of the hell-spawn which caused people contaminated with it to turn undead. Touching it won't matter, but don't let the black-blood touch YOUR blood. Don't swallow or breath it either. Of course I doubt you'd go around being stupid enough to taste the stuff..."

"Hey, I asked you a question: what was that thing?" said James.
"I thought I answered: It's a Familliar. A high-level winged imp." replied Blank

"First: I'm a bit new to the terminology and classification of hell-spawn. Second: that's not what I meant. That thing...that familliar knew your name and you its."

"Well in order, my dear sergeant. First: you don't need to remember what they are called. Only that they are demons and therefore need to die. Second: that specific creature-"

"Holy shaait! Hell's bells!!" jubelated Lenggries after Petrova had turned on the remaining lights of the room from a switch-board on the opposite side. It appeared to be a highly secure storage room, but just no any kind...

"Hey commander, the God-of-War must be smiling on us today; guess where we currently are standing."

"An arsenal." said James.
"Not just any arsenal, comrade..." corrected Lenggries and laughed deeply and gruffly.
12523112.title: Old friends.

choices: They re-enter the door from which they fled from the'gate-keepers.
They take the back door of the arsenal.
125231121.content:
Weapons and ammunition covering the entire spectrum of warfare lined the halls and racks and walls of the spacious storage room.
Crates containing every standardized caliber round and clip was packed in one corner and on the opposite wall, like clothes being advertised on hooks in a clothing store, was firearms of every imaginable type: pistols, revolvers, sub-machine guns, assualt-rifles, sniper-rifles, portable-grenade-launchers; even a fully-fledged(and armed) heavy-armor anti-vehicular automated missile launcher.

Right next to the very same wall sat an oil-barrel filled with fragmentation pine-apple grenades, as if someone had recklessly pilled the lot of them somewhere just to get rid of them. There were 10 such barrels, each filled to the brim with grenades....

"Just where...what is this?" asked Petrova, amazed like the rest.
"I don't know. There isn't supposed to be an arms-depot in this facility compound." replied Blank.

"Who cares?" said Lenggries. "It's a blessing from Mars! We were running short of ammo anyway. We just hit the motherload vain of guns! And- Holy shit!!!"
He rushed over to one ammunition rack with orange warning tape and danger triangles, stating stating that only authorized personnel were to touch these. Lenggries touched them anyway and spat a particularly fluid slime on the warning...

A mechanical whirring from Lenggries's minigun converted right-arm, drew James's attention. It was transforming and folding on itself, finally to regress into a compact cyborg claw. The claw had 3 fingers, 2-hand fingers and an opposable thumb; not unlike a miniature forklift attached to the ball-bearing on the end of the iron cylinder that was now his lower arm instead of the minigun.
With it, he lifted a magazine clip which also had orange warning tape wrapped around it.

"M-16 rounds! Wanno know what's special about them?"

"They resemble your backside?" queried Petrova.
"Hike off! No, they're illegal. They are as against the Geneva-Convention as it gets! Anyone wants to tell me why?"
"They look just like any standard rounds to me, corporal." said James.
"I'm not your corporal, pretty boy!" said Lenggries while scratching the inside of his mutilated empty left eye-socket, the eye-patch moved on his forehead like a bandanna and the wounded scarred socket exposed, much to James's involuntary disgust. Cory looked away. "Oh am I scaring you my little wormfood-?"

"You are the munitions-expert, corporal." interjected Blank diplomatically. "Why don't you share with us your esteemed knowledge."

Lenggries gave another one of his crooked smiles; James suspected the disfigurement of the scar running down the left of his face, prevented the giant from smiling normally: "Air-pocket bursting inverted shells. You know that panzerphausts in the second-world-war could penetrate the tough exteriors of American tanks easily, right? It was because some brilliant german scientist had the idea of deliberately leaving part of the rocket nose empty in the middle. So when the rocket nose tip hits the side of the armor, the force behind it caused it to make the nose invert inwards under itself from the pressure and literally create a rocket blast in from of it whenever it hits something. So basically, the panzerphaust was a spit-second mega-sized blow-torch at point blank range when it hits the armor of our Shermans; like a hot knife carving through butter."

Lenggries threw the M-16 clip from his mechanical claw and caught it with his good hand: "These rounds are sorta similar. They burst the air when the make contact with their target; like making a miniature explosion. Normal 16 rounds are solid, they just go through meat. Not these little fine fuckers. They literally rip apart flesh from bone and make people into bursting meatball balloons. It's not pretty. Normal M-16 rounds wound people, these air-burst shells will make your lungs explode by just zooming past you as the atmosphere is literally sucked from your mouth and returned instantly with force in the displacement of the air-burst."

"So just what the hell is that supposed to mean?" asked Petrova impatiently; scratching her short-cut black hair. James noticed, now that he stood so close to her, that she had several piercings including a nose-ring and lip-ring. Along with the dragon and scorpion tattoos that covered her exposed shoulders and arms, it made her look exceedingly mean. Definitely the opposite of the type of woman you would aim to pick up at a bar. James suspected she would look relatively beautiful if she hadn't gone to such extreme lengths to modify her body and wear attire with the intent of projecting malevolence.

"Means you don't need to aim for vitals anymore." continued Lenggries, his fowl-language momentarily forgotten as he was obviously in his element: "A graze from one of these little basterds on someone's toe will tear his head off. This means, Pertrova, that we won't need to aim at undead heads to kill them. They will rip off all of a zombie's limbs in one go. Their bursting action will rip anything apart as long as we can lay our sights on them."

"Useful." was Blank's only comment. James grinned; Blank had proven earlier he certainly didn't need the air-burst rounds.

"So, Shcyfer Aaron Blank??" jeered James. "Sounds lovely."
"You will refraim from using my maiden names, Sergeant. You may refer to me as Luitenant, commander or even Blank if you so prefer. And for those of you idiots who prefer a less syllable intensive workout, Sir will do. Right Lenggries?"
"Eff off." shot the blond man from the side.

"I'll call you Blank, sir, if you tell me how that demon knew your name."
"I was about to tell you before, no need pull leverage on me, sergeant."
"And what did that familliar mean, by saying 'you will not exit the Gate', sounds like you intended to go through it, not close it." said James with hard eyes.

Blank smiled: "How serious. You think I'm up to some secret agenda?"
"I'd simply like to know what it meant."

Blank looked at James intensely with his red-pink eyes, he wasn't smiling: "Your first question: you will recall the familliar was Gabzagul. IT...has been a thorn in my side for a long time; ever since I've joined ATHER. I suspect we will run into him once more, before the night is over."

James looked confused, and pointed to the fresh corpse of the familliar. "But...you killed it...didn't you?"
"One does not actually kill demons, one simply sends them back to wherever the hell they were spawned from. Again no pun intended. Gabzagul will regenerate another body for its corrupted soul and re-enter our plane of existence through the Hell-Gate. Hence the cardinal importance of closing the Gate in the first place."

"But why would you need enter the Gate? Don't try to tell me that demon spoke gibberish, I saw in your eyes its words disturbed you." said James with weight.

Blank smirked, but there was no ill intent behind it, only bemusement: "My eyes? Sergeant, you remember Petrova saying that this was a one-way-trip?"
"Yeah."
"She was being literal about it. Regardless of the outcome of tonight, there will be one less member of this squad going back to the surface."
His words hung in the air like poison.
James opened his mouth: "Wha-"

Blank raised his gloved hand to indicate he wasn't done: "The Hell-Gate is less of a gate and more of a portal. A door between 2 dimensions. It's key lies in its realm of origin, i.e. in hell itself. To close the Gate you must stand in the realm of origin to deactivate and the destroy the key." He breathed. "One man must cross into hell and destroy the keystone there."

The silence was electric; James looked at Petrova and Lenggries, he could see both knew this already.
"But....how does that man come back."
"He doesn't." answered Blank simply, brutally. "Oh don't worry sergeant. As the senior officer here, I will be the one to destroy the keystone."

James swallowed, not out of nervousness but out of the gloominess of this topic: "Why didn't you say that when we met."
"You never asked. Now!" Blank changed the subject. "Now that the first leg of excitement is over, let's get moving!" James shook his head; again with the euphemisms. "I want that to be in that camera-room half an hour ago. Load up on whatever ammunition or weapons you deem necessary, and do so quickly gentlemen an lady."

What the hell is wrong with this guy? thought James. Just a moment ago he was talking about his inevitable doom and now...now he's giving orders like nothing's off.

Lenggries was already loading up on strips of MG rounds into his metal-backpack and hung a whole score of grenades on his belt and chest slings. He was carrying two M-16's, one in either hand (well one in hand and other in claw). His gargantuan size made them look like mere pistols in his massive fingers: "Saving on the minigun for later." he said.

Petrova wedged her one-third katana into the floor to clear her hand. James's eyebrows raised; the floor was solid concrete, that must be one fantastically sharp sword. She discarded her SMG for a PPKT machine-gun pistol and took the grenade-launcher slung across her back. Done, she retracted her katana from the cold floor; very much like Excaliber from the stone.

James kept his usual default armament, and only freshened up on ammo and some pineapples. He gave Cory a 9mm pistol: "Keep this on you."
"R-right."

Blank took nothing, not even spare clips. James grimaced; true he had shown in his skill he didn't need any more firearms, but this was like a grim preparation for the albino's death.
"Now then. To the security-console. Let's go stir up some trouble..."
125231121.title: Lock and Load.

1252311212.content:
"Do you sense any dead people, worm food?" turning to Cory, Lenggries asked.

"Go shoot your balls off, cyclops." giving a red raspberry with his dark tongue, Cory retorted.

Petrova stifled a giggle as Blank gave his first thin smile. "Too late, kid." dryly, he said. "Someone beat him to it."

"Do ya sense something or not, you rotting piece of shit!?" turning red, Lenggries demanded.

"Back off, Lenggries." with a cold stare, Blank ordered. he then turned to Cory. "Well?"

"I- I sense one but... its like the other you fought, Mr Blank." shaking slightly, Cory replied. "I barely sense it there."

"Drop the 'Mr' shit, okay?" softly, Blank said. "Just call me Blank or sir."

"Yes, Blank." nodding, Cory said.

"Where do you sense this thing?" calmly, Petrova asked.

"In the next hall, passed the other door." pointing, Cory replied.

"How can you sense these things?" curious, James asked.

"Its a sixth sense you develop after years in combat or a few hours in hell." serious, Lenggries said. "You just know when there is an enemy nearby. You can't explain it without experiencing it yourself, you just know." pausing, he added, "I sensed the hell spawn the second we got in here, I'm just waiting to see if it will come to us of if it is waiting for us."

"Its... 'him', isn't it?" giving Lenggries a scorned look, Petrova asked.

Lenggries nodded. "It's him." he confirmed. "The hell spawned bastard born ass fucking ball breaking jack ass who took my eye and my arm!"

"Second date?" daring to make a joke, Cory asked.

Lenggries gave the boy a crooked smile. "You could say that." darkly amused, he said.

"We have no time for any grudge match." sternly, Blank said.

"Nor do we have time to avoid who or whatever is trying to find our big friend." pointed out James.

Lenggries walked to the door and grabbed the handle. "We have to go this way to get to the security rooms anyway." gruffly, he said. "If we don't meet him, fine." he then smiled again. "If we do, so much the better."

With that, he opened the door to reveal a towering humanoid form. It was covered from head to toe in a strange type of armor with a helmet that hid his entire head from view. As the group gazed upon the creature, they all noticed the same thing, the creature had a human eye in a small, fluid filled container, hanging from a chain around its neck.

http://img502.imageshack.us/img502/6652/...

"Give me back my eye, you bloody bastard!" charging the creature, Lenggries screamed.

The creature let out an unnatural roar, causing Cory to shiver in fright. James held the boy tight to himself as he reached for his heavy gun, a S&W X-frame Model 500. It was the most powerful handgun in the world, or so he believed. He was about to level it onto the creature when Blank gently pushed his hand down. "This is a grudge match." sternly but softly, he said. "That creature annihilated his entire family but fled when faced against Lenggries wrath."

"He'd be pissed if anyone got in his way." touching James' shoulder, Cory said. "I know I would."
1252311212.title: They take the back door of the arsenal.

choices: POV: The ambush on the rest of the squad.
12523112121.content:
"Right." said Blank calmly to Petrova and James, beckoning to the door they came in. "I think it wise we back up some, lest we get caught between this...disagreement."

Lenggries was already advancing on the Beast, oblivious to his companions, while swearing vehemently and laughing dementedly; seeming every bit the part of a dangerous lunatic having escaped the asylum. The 2 M-16's were duel-wielded like pistols in his massive pawlike hand and bionic claw; Lenggries scraped them by the nozzles on the cement floor, like a gladiator scraping his swords in the sand of the colosseum to indicate his clear hostility to his opposition; a malevolent vengeful leer crossing his face in the form of his usual crooked grim grin.

"We can't just leave him on his own!" cried James in disgust at Blank's suggestion. James truly disliked the big blond man, but Lenggries was ATHER-personnel and therefore a comrade.

"Sure we can!" said Petrova callously, already making way to the entrance of the sliding-door. "I don't want to be near a mile-radius of those barbarians when they spar. Lenggries is a big boy. He can take care of himself."
"What??" said James in disbelief.
"Yeah! What?! He's your friend." accused Cory, surprising all by coming to the defense of his tormentor. "You're just too scared to help him against that monster!"

Blank chuckled darkly: "Again you both misunderstand. We're not afraid of the hellspawn, Sergeant. We're afraid of Lenggries. He's a berserker. When deeply angered, as he is...obviously now, he gains tremendous strength, but loses his capacity to distinguish between friend and foe. If we dare to intervene in his fight, while he's in this blood-crazed state, he'll just tear us apart like a mad-dog in a frenzy taking bites at all around him. We will only do greater harm than good, mostly to ourselves, if we try to help the reckless idiot."

As if to prove Blank, Lenggries pulled up the two M-16's; sprinted straight to the Beast (which stood on a towered collection of wooden crates) and opened fire; almost quite literally as the flames leaked from the barrels of the M-16's, setting the wooden boxes alight next to the Beast with the specialized atmospheric air-burst ammunition. Showing unnatural agility for its bulking armoured elephantine frame, the creature jumped with the grace of a flee, and out of Lenggries' fire onto a nearby ledge.

The Beast pulled back his arms; pumped out his chest after bashing it, and imperiously let loose a second blood-curling roar which would have made maned-lions bolt with their tales between their legs.

Very much unfazed, Lenggries re-aligned the creature back into his sights and unleashed his own version of a war-cry. Or rather a string of verbal abuse and continuous colourful cursing; the likes of which being most unbefitting for a soldier of ATHER.

"Come down here, you motherfucking cowardly crap!! Your not worth the rat-shit that maggots refuse to eat! In fact: your lower than shark shit shade at the bottom of the sea abyss!" James listened to Lenggries' tirade in bemusement and admiration. The man may be out of his mind, but he certainly showed boundless bravery to talk so indifferently to a demon!

A second blazing barrage of fiery bullets from Lenggries proved equally as ineffective as the first, as the creature simply jumped behind a stack of barrels. Lenngries ran sideways to get a clear line-of-sight from the obscuring barrels, only to see an oil drum hurling through the air to meet his face.
Thinking on his feet (again literally), Lenggries leap-rolled out of the way; the oil-drum smashed into concrete floor with a bone-jarring impact, only a few feet from where Lenngries would have been.

Looking up up at the metallic balcony, Lenngries saw the creature bowling several drums, as if they were mere paperweight tennis balls, right at him! In a gruelingly deadly live version of a dodge-ball game of bone-braking proportions , Lenggries tried to avoid and evade the quarter-ton drums smashing like meteorites next to him, each braking and bursting nearer than the last. But his luck ran out...

The very last drum had spilled several squirts of oil on the floor, on which Lenggries tripped, and was sent sprawling...
Falling face-first into mother-earth made Lenngries lose grip of the M-16's. Not even hesitating for an instant he rolled sideways. This saved his life as an explosion of a million-billion woody splinters occupied the same space as he had only a split-second ago, courtesy of a huge crate which the beast had thrown.

The rest of the party till this point had silently watched the show-off from the edge of the room and out of the way, completely absorbed by the duel of these 2 giants. Because of their attention being captivated by their struggling comrade, they failed to notice 2 figures slithering downwards from the dark lamp-less ceiling, behind their backs.....

Back into the fight, Lenggries shot up from where he lay in a prone position on the ground, and turning, he hurled a 2-second pre-capped pineapple grenade at the beast. Since the mammoth creature had been in the midst of picking up another massive crate, he could not jump out of the way beneath the weight as previously in time, and suffered the full ballooning blast of the detonation. Flames and smoked swallowed the balcony, sending the packed crates up there earthwards in scorched, burning fragments.

Lenggries, knowing full well the creature not to be defeated so easily, quickly scoured the floor for his M-16 assault rifles that had been sent flying from his hands. Dejectedly, he found them crushed to pieces beneath the last thrown wooden crate.

The now familiar fierce roaring of the beast alerted Lenggries to its re-appearance; this time of the opposite site of the enclosed room on yet another pile pf crates. It stood, mostly unharmed, its armour merely blackened by the smoke-blast.

Lenggries pointed at it with his bionic claw: "I'm not done with you yet, you sonofabitch!!! I'll tear you a new one so bad, that after I'm through with ya, they'll have to scrape yer face of the floor just to find what's left of ya!!!"

"I PROMISE YOU SUFFERING, MORTAL!" croaked the gargantuan demon in raspy deep grinding voice: "AFTER I COLLECT THE REST OF YOU..." it said, dangling the fluid-container with the eye mockingly in front of Lenggries. "I'LL SHOW YOU FEAR, PAIN AND MISERY FOR THE REST OF ETERNITY-!"

Ever simple-mindedly deviant to any source not letting him have his way, Lenggries impatiently interrupted: "And I'll show you how it feels to have a led brick up yer arse!!"
With that Lenggries raised his bionic-cyborg arm, and with a pneumatic whoose, shot the claw-hand-segment like the war-head of a harpoon-gun; a rubbery-chain-rope trailing its flight. The razor forklift-like claw latched on the momentarily astonished Beast's chest, securing itself as the anchor of the inbuilt grappling-hook of Lenggries' mechanized arm.

Grinning evilly, Lenggries pulled down hard...

At the same both Blank and Cory spun around, having sensed the 2 entities which had crept up on the rest of the party and cried in semi-unison: "Behind us.....!"
Guns ready, Petrova and James turned...
12523112121.title: Death match!

125231121212.content:
Petrova had, unlike James or Blank, kept her personal weapons unsheathed and at arms length(and in fact in her hands) the entire time. She had held her katana-wielding hand directly beneath and supporting the hand aiming her PPKT machine-gun pistol; much the same way as police officers whom entered dark areas stabilized the underside of their sidearms on top of their flashlights, only Petrova instead of a torch had held her katana horizontally under her PPKT.

Because of this, she was well prepared for the demonic creature that had made a grab for her; in a flash of finesse and swift steel, she severed the claws clutching for her neck, and leaped backwards to gasp in horror at the unsightly sight of exactly what the FUCK had almost touched her-

The two...things, that had slivered from the ceiling were so hideously ugly and misfigured, that they would have caused miscarriages at the mere sight of them. They looked constructed and sown together from the body parts of several separate human corpses, and very crudely done so. The stitches holding together the pieces of flayed skin came loose like the worn seems of ripped plushies, exposing the rotten flesh held within. Disgustingly putrid black puss dripped from these primitive works of surgery and the gleaming whiteness of exposed bones shone from where the crudely connected limbs were poorly attached.

The two creatures looked as if some demented Frankenstein-wannabee surgeon had tried to create giant spiders out of the remains of a crematorium. The torso of each was devoid of legs and instead had 8 or more disfigured arms attached (some with their hands amputated; the amputations being just below the joint, so that the sawn wrists scratched on the floors like broken antelope hooves), at random intervals along the ribs.

And from the back of the sternum of each of these freakish monsters, a giant thick scorpion-like tail rose and flailed around; this 'tail' seemed the destination of the missing legs as they consisted of 2 pairs patched together from foot to hip joint, as if a sadistic child had torn of the legs of a couple of his action figures and had stuck them together with prestick glue, end-on-end.
And at the very end of each "tail": the amputated hands were worked into opossable crablike clamps; the fingers interlocking.

But it was their heads that would haunt dreams and scar the minds of children. They had no faces. No eyes or ears or noses or hair; only sickly bleached bald domes hanging from their necks. How they saw and navigated and moved without the aid of sight or senses was beyond speculation.
They did have mouths though. But not human mouths, holy shit no! Tendrils similar to those of sea-anemones hanged from where the lips would have been; grey-purple gutlike tongues wormed around as if they were tentacles.

A nightmarish sight for sore eyes(for causing them, not curing them!); for they induced cringed shuddering to whomever gazed upon them...

"Spread out! Flank them!" Blank bellowed orders, his skillfully drawn Glock once again appearing in his hand with such magical speed that frontier cowboy-gunmen would have been put to shame. 3 quick consecutive shots rang out from his sidearm, aim perfectly placed on the egglike head of the second monstrosity.

But the creature seemed not to share the same weakness of zombies, for despite having its greymatter displaced, it proceeded to advanced undeterred. Momentarily caught of guard at the creatures invulnerability, Blank was given little time to evade the 3 arms that swung and smashed him out of the way as if he were a mere cardboard cutout, sending him sliding on the concrete floor.

"Watch out, Sergeant!" warned Blank to James, still firing( and impeccably aimed) at vital points on the creature, all the while he slid to a standstill. But heart-wounds similarly had no effect in slowing down the monster, which now made a bee-line for James and Cory, showing supernatural spiderlike speed for its disfigured limbs; sometimes crawling, sliding, slithering or scraping eratically across the floor..

James, having seen the relentlessness of the creature, discarded Cory roughly to the side away from him, like a rebellious teenager throwing his school backpack aside the moment he got home. But this was a selfless action to rid Cory from harm, who grunted as he fell. CAR15 firing from one hand and Colt .45 blazing from the other, James filled the beast with holes, while walking slowly backwards to maintain a distance and range from it for as long as possible.

Bullets seemed not as futile as before, as the monster swayed and shuddered beneath the barrage James's constant and competent haelstorm of led. 2 of its arms actually fell of as James shot through the already detached stitches.

Petrova meanwhile had been re-living Hercules' legendary struggle with the Hydra. She had fended off and parried and cut away the persistent grabbings that the arms of the first spider-like monster made at her. She cleaved, cut and carved off every grotesque hand, finger and arm in turn, but the monster had chased her into a corner, where she struggled desperately to keep it at bay with her katana. Her razor-edged short-sword flashed like greased lightning through the dimly lit underground lightning, shredding the monster apart, piece by ever larger body part piece, as if she were hewing a hedge.

Yet still it refused to slow down, seemingly immune to pain or damage. Not even piercing its brain or heart would bring it to its...knees...or whatever it had!!

The creature then suddenly bit at her, but she blocked its terrible mouth with her PPKT and while it stood there, stupidly chewing at the metallic nozzle of her firearm, she arced her finger and pulled the trigger. Being even closer than point-blank range ensured that the force of her machine-gun pistol's rapid fire erupted the back of the monster's eggshell head into a gory bursting massive zip.

For the 1st time since its ambush, the creature-construct relented on its aggressive assualt as a result of its obliterated head. Seizing this chance by its by the he-... never mind you get the idea, she just ceased the ****ing chance!

Swiftly unslinging the grenade-launcher she had skied from the armory arsenal from her bare tattoo'd shoulders, Petrova trusted it up close and personal into the pulverized neck-piece of the monster and pulled the trigger.

"Back to hell with you, you scrap!!" Not as original a come-back as the fowl-mouthed Lenggries, but who could blame her after a life and death struggle?

The powerful punch of the launched grenade being ejected into the monster, sent it reeling backwards into the wall as if pounded by a pinball spring, where it smashed, momentarily stunned. It gave of one threatening screeching sound before the delayed grenade embedded into it exploded, turning it into a butchery's waste. Pitch-black bile, guts and gore rained down on Petrova, where she could but stand stiff with her arms to her sides and accept the revolting rain washing her over...

James on his end was being strangled by the scorpion "tail" of the second creature; its hands-clamp-claw-thing holding him by the throat into the air. Gasping and chocking, James tried to pry off onto the clasping fingers against his collar, while unleashing the remainder of his CAR15's clip into the creature's spine. The creature groaned from inside its stomach, but continued its strangling, unfazed by the bullets raking its back.

"Do I have to do everything myself?!" asked Blank standing back up from the floor, seeming more irritated at James' failure to dispose of this 'minor' obstacle rather than being petrified or concerned for the life of his endangered colleague. Staying true to his masterful marksmanship, Blank proceeded to break apart 5 of the spider-creature's arms, by shooting through it joints.

Blank swore under his breath as his magazine ran empty before he could finish destroying all of the monster's limbs, but he had done enough. Distracted at the loss of its extremities, the creature released a bit of its grip on James's squashed lung-pipe, giving him the breather to react.

James popped a pineapple from his belt and in an act sheer badassedness shoved his entire fist and forearm through the creature's gaping maw that had been chomping at his feet, before releasing the grenade and pulling his hand out before the monster could eat it off. In the same motion his other arm came up, clutching a serrated KA-BAR trench knife which cleaved through the clamp-fingers still embracing his neck, like a hot poker through butter, releasing James to fall back to earth.

Boots meeting cement-floor, James jump-rolled out off the way just as the freakish-creature imploded into the splattering smithereens of down-pouring bile, black-blood and body parts. Intestines and unknown ruined organs covered the floor. Following suit after Petrova, James was also drenched by this less than appetizing rainfall.

Regrouping, the party assembled. Cory smilingly pointed at James and Petrova, both now soaking in the gory liquid remains of the stitched creatures: "You need a bath. You stink."

"Yes." concurred Blank with a poker face, pulling his leather gloves which had gone loose in all the excitement, back tight into place, the rest of his attire of course being spotless: "ATHER personnel should ensure their uniforms remain presentable at all times. I'm deeply disappointed. How unsoldierly."

He received dark looks. But the group was alerted by a the inhuman screaming of Lenggries back in the storage room they had just left....
125231121212.title: Ambush.

1252311212122.content:
Blank rose a single eyebrow, showing some surprise, as the group saw Cory running through the room, charging the beast Lenggries was fighting with. The creature threw a crate at the advancing boy but, like the creature, he easily dodged it and kept advancing until he was right on top of the beast. Cory grabbed the chain of the eyeball on the necklace and ran off, breaking the clasp as he took the necklace with him. "You fight like a monkey, ugly!" running with his prize, Cory taunted. "Let's see how you do in a fair fight!"

"You insect!" furious, the creature roared. "That's my prize!"

The creature began to fire a barrage of laser blasts at Cory only, having escaped the gates of hell, dodging light beams was a 'cake walk' to him. Upon reaching Lenggries, he handed him the necklace. "Maybe you'll aim better with two eyes!"

Lenggries grabbed the necklace before taking out the eye; it was mechanical! He moved the eye patch aside and popped in the eyeball, reactivating his sight. "Thanks... maggot!" sneering, he said. "Now out of the way!"

"Wow, I went from worm food to maggot." reaching James, Cory said.

A very slight smile formed onto Blank's face. "You earned a few points, kid." nodding, he said. "Just don't expect much, Lenggries doesn't let anyone too close for a reason."

Cory nodded then turned back to the battle inside the room as Lenggries mechanical eye shot forth a laser sight, targeting the creature as he gave his famous crooked grin. "My turn!"
1252311212122.title: A little terror.

choices: Detour: Does the party go shower first and clean themselves of the black blood?
No-Detour: Does the party head straight to the camera room?
12523112121221.content:
Mechanical whirring, clicking and clanking was emitted by Lenggries' cyborg arm as it transformed once more and reverted back into its original minigun-state. Crooked smile and foul-swearing (the likes of which would have put salted sailors to blushing) ever present, Lenggries started towards the Demon Beast.

"Party Time, mother-fucker! Let's paint the walls! I like red....or whatever the FUCK the colour of your blood is, freakshow!"
With his newly gained depth perception, Lenggries' aim was substancially improved and the phosphorous tracers of his suppressed minigun fire found its mark on the Demon Beast in very short order.

"I'm gonna make you my gun's bitch, you fuck-off!" Lenggries screamed half-crazed as the Beast jumped time again and again out of his line of fire. Unfortunately whilst Lenggries kept the Beast on its toes, he simply couldn't get a round on its agile grasshopper-like jumping form.

Thinking quickly on his feet, James popped his last pineapple grenade and flung it with all the might in his arms.....to precisely where the Demon Beast ended up in one of its flea jumps. Smoke and shrapnel followed the detonation as the Beast was sent floor-wards.

This time, before it could stand up, its colossal frame was raked by minigun fire so violently that a shadow of its putrid black blood formed against the wall standing directly behind it. Its body turned to resemble a cheese grater, the beast collapsed with a finishing finality. But Lenggries walked over to the beast and kicked it for good measure and even loosened several dozen rounds for safety's sake.

"Dead." he yelled callously as if declaring the fate of the newest road kill. Following that he pulled out his mechanical cyborg eye and licked it clean - quite grotesquely so - before popping it back into his skull.

"You know that's utterly disgusting, right?" asked Petrova with her nose pulled up.
"What, like taking a dip in demon blood?" retorted Lenggries, pointing to her soaked form.
"Don't anyone ever mention this day to me..." she said, shuddering as if during autumn chills.

"There are showers next to the following hall." Cory said helpfully.

"Blank...." she said, begging. To which he just sighed:"That counts as dawdling, but...very well."

"Hey kid...." said Lenggries; his face contorted as if he was trying to get something heavy off of his chest, but at last he managed: "Thanks....but if you dare tell anyone I said so, I'll pull off your head and shit down your neck, you got me wormfood?!"

Cory just smiled brightly, completely unintimidated by Lenggries this time as he knew this to be his ...unique way of being sincere.

"With that...little bit of excitement out of the way, may we all please proceed to the Camera-Room now?" asked Blank, with his usual dose of euphemisms. The party concurred and Cory jumped back onto James' back - this time James followed Petrova's example and carried his armaments in his arms.

James said: "Let's first go to..."
12523112121221.title: Round two!

choices: Petrova's POV - Because every good horror tale needs fanservice...
125231121212211.content:
"WHAT?!" raged Lenggries. "A shower?! Now? Of all times? Of all places?! Insert random generic sexist joke about women right here, baby!!"
"Oh, shut up, you pig!" retorted Petrova. "You try getting bathed in guts!"

"Actually...Lenggries. I think it advisable that James and Petrova both wash away the black blood that covers them ASAP. We are few enough as is. I can't afford to lose any more troops to the undead." Way to go, Blank, James thought. No sentiment lost there about us dying or anything. "We need to get them to showers the kid was talking about. I don't know whether the contamination can spread through dermatological contact."

"Through what contact?" asked Lenggries, chewing his lip.

"Blood. On. Skin." the albino said: "I don't know what'll happen if they merely touch the blood. Best we not try and and find out."

"Let's just get a move on, then!" hissed Petrova impatiently; her nervous voice betraying her stress at the talks of her likelyhood of turning into a zombie: "I'll take point! Come on!"

None argued or lingered, and the squad moved at a brisk pace through the storeroom in which Leggries had slain his arch foe and into the shadows beyond. Cory played the part of navigator from James' back; indicating the road to the facility's bathroom showers.

Despite their haste, the party kept their eyes peeled, ears open and 6th senses to the max, to ensure they wouldn't be caught off guard and suffer a second ambush. The penetrating silence amplified the irritating electrical fluctuations of the flickering lamp-lights; making the party jittery and nervous. Twice Petrova fired at her own shadow; Lenggries shot a mirror reflecting his ugly scowl; Blank
accidentally killed a rat.

"This is getting ridiculous!" muttered James to no one in particular. Only the shadows to answer him.
"Agreed. Let's get to the console station directly after you and Petrova had a good dunk."

But the group met no resistance. Not even any stray zombies, demons or monsters. Only empty room after concrete room, corridor after blood spattered corridor. The lack of action was more unnerving than the presence of a physical visible threat.

At long, overdue last: the Bathroom Showers.

"It's quiet! Too damned quiet. Lets make some noise!" said Lenggries out loud, much to the unraveling nuisance of his comrades.

"You are SUCH and asshole." said Petrova with barely concealed contempt.

"What?" whined Lenggries. "It got bloody boring after the 3rd empty room! I have my eye back, people! I feel like a million bucks! What am I supposed to do with this energy? Let's shoot shit up, already!"

"This isn't some video-game, comrade! The preservation of earth itself is at stake!" reprimanded Blank; rubbing his temple with index finger and thumb out of frustration: "Go be a headache elsewhere: go be lookout, guard the main hall!"

Lenggries belched, spat and farted (all in that order) to show how little he regarded opinions of him and turned tails marching and humming a tune: "Nobody loves me. Everybody hates me. I'm gonna eat some worms."

James just shook his head in wonderment: "Just who is that guy?"

"Lenggries?" the albino answered, relighting a cigarette he had dug out from somewhere in his ink-black leather garb: "Lengries is Lenggries. Rude, crude, disobedient, brutal, hard, psychotic. Any other positive traits I've missed, Petrova?"

"He's a reckless barbarian." replied Petrova; but this time with softness in her voice; as if she really did care after the oaf after all.

"Ah, yes of course.: no sense of self preservation. Lenggries in a nutshell." said Blank smirking, inhaling smoke: "But I'm being unfair; especially behind a man's back. That doesn't do him justice. Lenggries is steadfast and honest, once you get to know the basterd. He may be a rough man, but he's loyal to the bitter end to his comrades."

"If you gents will excuse me, this girl will be getting some private time." said Petrova before disappearing into the unisex bathroom to rid herself of the black bile which still clung to her and her uniform.

"Where was I?" Blank asked James.
"Lenggries being loyal, despite being an ass."
"Ah. You see James, I'd rather have one of Lenggries at my side than 20 of you...no, no, don't interrupt...you proved your worth tenfold today...I mean trust in experience. I'd be willing to brave hell with only a bucket of water had I Lenggries to back me up. Something which might actually happen tonight, come to think of it..."

"I see..." said James.
"So he's a good guy after all." asked Cory, ever the child.
Blank chuckled, cynical eyebrow raised to its default position: "We'll he's certainly not a paragon...a saint if that's what your asking..."

A bone, marrow and everything in between chilling soprano scream sent the party all from conversation to combat mode in an instant. Petrova! They dashed to her!
125231121212211.title: Clean.

info.brief_description: An Anti-Terrorism Unit has a new enemy to face, Hell itself.
info.description:
A cult has been kidnapping large groups of people and sacrificing them to their "dark lords." naturally they were labeled as terrorists, hence why the counter-terrorism unit known as ATHER was sent in as soon as the cult's compound was found to rescue the hostages and eliminate the cult. Before they reached the lowest level of the compound the last group of people was sacrificed and the gate to hell was opened. The cult's joy was short lived as the demons preceded to slaughter them and the ATHER personnel. ATHER personnel have no communications with the outside world do to inference from the gate. Now the surviving members of ATHER have a new mission, keep the demons from escaping the compound and causing a bloody end to the human race. To do this you'll have to find the book that opened the gate in the first place, just ignore the army of demons standing in your way and the fact the book is lost on the rather large compound somewhere.


Main character: Sergeant James Anderson, leader of ECHO team. He is a 38 year old combat vet who has been with ATHER for the last 10 years. He became separated from his team shortly after the gate was opened and is unaware of that hell has been unleashed....yet. He wears standard ATHER combat gear. Blue coat, dark blue pants, Black combat boots and vest, helmet, goggles and fingerless gloves. He is armed with a CAR15 with red dot scope, grip and flashlight attachment and a colt .45.
